description:
Friday, 9:00PM.

Quickie:
+ Food quality
+ Service
* Hygiene
* Turnaround
+ Menu variety

And then...?
Friendly staff dishin' and servin' up comfort food. Yum!

**********
Stuffed my face in:
1. Fresh Mac n' Cheese
     + Firm texture = drool
2. Meat Loaf With Tangy Tomato Sauce
     + Tang adds a nice undertone 

Constructive comments:
*Source ingredients
*Compost options
author: Chuck N.

description:
The deli Is absolutely excellent the staff for our Miriam and her deli staff which are wonderful

Unfortunately the bakery staff is very unprofessional and there have been numerous complaints about the bakery staff
Owners have been contacted to try and deal with their bakery staff which have made many customers uncomfortable and hurt during their process of trying to buy baked goods

We would not advise using their bakery Due to the behavior of the staff.
Until owners take action to fix this problem.
author: Ornaandfergal H.

description: Tall lady at the counter is absolutely unprofessional, , rude and unfriendly.... my last time buying food here .
author: paul c.

description: The bakery has some good treats in there but  the hot food bar is ridiculously over priced for food that is really just ok. It is definitely not worth what you wind up paying
author: Adam M.

description: Super rude staff. They have a limit on their "free water" so be careful when you get a cup not to drink it so fast. I was kicked out of the cafe and refused service, because I got water while waiting to order a muffin. Can't say that they are very hygienic either. I witnessed the guy working go from money to food w/o hand washing. This place really used to be good. Not sure what happened.
author: Dustin S.

description:
What attracts me to this place is their delicious pastries and selection of gluten free goods. 

They are expensive but since I like what they serve, I go back occasionally. 

One thing that I really don't appreciate after spending a little extra on a pastry and a cup of coffee is the service. The girls who work the counter are super rude. 

Who wants to spend extra money at a place where the employees are consistently rude to you? They don't greet you and only look at you when you're ready to purchase something. 

 I live in the neighborhood and been coming here on and off for awhile but enough is enough and I've had enough of this poor service and will go elsewhere for my sweets. 

Steer clear of the bad energy at the counter.
author: Carina C.

description:
Another bad experience.

Shitty expensive coffee.

The croissants that used to be buttery and flaky are now dry and tasteless (did they start buying them at Costco?)

Not sure why they get 4 stars, I guess the yuppies are not that picky.
author: Monkey B.

description:
**Bakery catering review only. 

I ordered 36 mini cupcakes for a baby shower weeks before the event. I spoke with Bob over the phone who confirmed availability and reassured me they'd have my order ready for pick up at 8am sharp. On day of event, I arrive at 8am sharp and the staff are still setting up for the day (half empty case of desserts). My order was not ready as promised. Thankfully I had my confirmation printed and the lady tells me it'd be another 10 min. to package. I suspect the staff had no knowledge of my order. I was disappointed my order was not ready as promised given the limited time I had but especially since I placed my order weeks in advance. 

The cupcakes itself were OK. Not great but not terrible. I suspect the cupcakes were not freshly baked but refrigerated. They were cold at pick up and some of the frosting had condensation. At $1.95 / piece, I would pay a little more for Kara's or Suzie Cakes next time.
author: Claudia H.

description: How is it that nobody knows about this place? I commute to the Peninsula every day for work and this place is a great spot to grab breakfast along the way. The quality of the food is really high and the grab and go setup is super convenient!
author: Avo I.

description:
Why are the younger cashiers here SO rude? i asked for a napkin and got an attitude and she sarcastically said "just one?" horrible customer service for food that's drastically declined in quality but increased in price. i've had at least five times this year of the younger girls in the front showing me awful customer service. it's a slow day, all she's doing is talking to her coworkers and looking at her phone. no line but i was treated like i was disturbing her by purchasing my items

also, all the food at the "hot bar" is usually lukewarm at best. today everything is cold in the middle, not sure how they make it past health inspections.
author: Jennifer B.

description: Hidden gem. The selection and tastiness of their hot food is better than Whole Foods'. Pleasant counter service.
author: Inigo M.

description: What's up w this place? Cold, dry Fried Chicken, salad isn't really fresh, and way overpriced! I've come here a few times and it's been quite mediocre but this time I had to write a review. I get that it's a hot food bar, and food is left out for awhile, but they can do better than this.
author: Jojo M.

description: I was looking for a good tres leches cake for my cousins birthday. And I stumbled upon this little gem while looking down town mission area. The cake was sooooo good. We tried the smaller piece that I felt was like a tester. The fluffy part of the cake just melted in your mouth. The cake was wet but fluffy. It was just so good. We had to get the bigger size. Really enjoyed the energy of the place. The staff was really nice as well. I Will definitely get my cake from here again.
author: Yasuko R.

description: Their cakes are fabulous.  I always go here for birthday cakes...including my own!  The Persian Love Cake is amazing and worth a try.  But, the mocha and other chocolate cakes are fabulous!
author: Norah M.

description:
I have a sweet tooth.  I've made a sport of bakery noshing.  I used to have a tradition of visiting a bakery every Sunday.  I watch what I eat during the week, but on weekends all bets are off.  And Sunday was bakery day.  Order a smorgasbord of goodies, & just go to town.  What bakery?  I hit them all.  Miette, Kara's, That Takes The Cake, Cups & Cake, Sweet Things, Tartine, Boulange (all of them), Noe, John Campbell's, Arizmendi, Schubert's...they were all a part of my rotation.  They each have things that they do better than others; they're all stars in their own right.  I will leave their specific details for further reviews.  But Delessio's?  I could never forget Delessio's.  

When I hear Delessio's, I think of 3 things...

Tres leches cake.  I drool.

Chocolate bubble wrap.  Yes, chocolate bubble wrap.  And yes.  It's even cooler than it sounds.  You can order it by the slice, pound, or in major bulk for parties or events.  

And my favorite...The Rabanada.  A Brazilian specialty.  Bread soaked in a sublime custard mixture & then fried, & then covered in cinnamon sugar.  This is SINFULLY good.  One bite & I'm flooded w bliss, guilt, & regret.  But bliss always wins.  I'm perfectly aware of how bad this is for me, & I just don't give a damn.  I can always just double my treadmill time for a couple of days.  Happily so.  It's that good.  

It takes your coffee or tea to a different dimension. 

Btw, they have great food too.  The honey teriyaki style chicken is fabulous.  And the sandwiches rock.

Delessio's is always a pleasure.
author: Veronica M.

description: I stopped in at Delessio looking for a small birthday cake for a friend. It was a bit last minute on a Thursday night after work so I was glad to find a nice bakery open after work hours. If not for Delessio, I would have had to stop by Safeway or Whole Foods. They had a nice selection available still and I ended up choosing the malted vanilla cake. My friend was delighted with the cake and I was glad to have been able to find something special to spice up a weekday birthday. I liked that the malted vanilla cake was pieced together in a unique way. Something different than your regular off the shelf grocery store birthday cake.
author: Alice H.

description: Always delicious, healthy, vibrant hot food and divine cakes! Best mac and cheese in town!
author: Andrea S.

description:
Cheers to this store in Lower Haight! I came here with two friends from my friend's recommendation. This store reminds of a Whole Foods/Berkeley Bowl where you have the grocery part of the store, and there is a hot food/salad bar on the side. We ate the sidebar, which was mighty delicious. 

FOOD: Thai chicken. The only chicken somebody needs in their life. It is quite good, seasoned well, and they also have the sweet Thai sauce on it. Also, the ribs are really good which has good fall off the bone texture and isn't covered completely in sauce. The polenta cakes are really good too, where the cornmeal isn't dry or too dense. I also liked the cabbage dish they had. The cabbage was cooked in a way to remove that cabbage-y taste with some acid and apples I believe. Mighty good! 

Weighed by the pound and you can get a rewards card for paying for 10 pounds and get the 11th for free! 

A great place if you want something fast and delicious after you finish grocery shopping.
author: Albert H.

description:
I am here two days in a row already enjoying their awesomely delicious and creative foods at the cold and hot food bar! Sooo good! I really appreciate their detail to depth in flavor and their creativeness in integrating fresh herbs and  local ingredients into their food. I can taste it! There is nice outdoor seating with clean fresh side walks and they also have a card you can accumulate points to get free food! There is wine by the glass and Oh yes, Slocome ice cream.  

Come here on a warm sunny afternoon and enjoy the tasting adventures! Will keep their catering services in mind as I'm sure the quality is just as good!
author: Calibear E.

description: I pay more here than at whole foods hot bar, but I appreciate the variety. Those roasted carrots are basically cooked in delicious butter. The raspberry crumb bar is huge and delicious and also full of butter :) The staff are always there, and they are normal. It's a hot bar.
author: Victoria C.

description: Came at 745pm and tres letche cake was sold out  but was able to get some ice cream ... They have another store on market street also they don't make bakery items here they're made at market street location. Humphry ice cream is always amazing and organic too! Love it! I will be back tomorrow morning for my cake
author: Allan C.

description: I like the baked goods and the convenience of shopping here.  I stopped by this afternoon to purchase a cake for a friends birthday.  It wasn't busy and the gal working was sitting on a stool behind the counter.  She wasn't very friendly and acted like she didn't care.  I noticed most of the tables in the dining section were dirty.
author: Brian H.

description: Looking for a quick great breakfast? This is the place! Wonderful omelettes, amazing pastries, totally fresh foods. It's the hybrid version of Whole Foods with a local touch.
author: Mickey B.

description:
SO i love when places have already made food. When im starving and need something to eat fast, quick and delicious... Delessio is my "GO TO" shop. They give you a loyalty card that gives you one pound of free food when you buy 10 pounds. It might sound like a lot of food but trust me, if you live close by, the ten pounds adds up quick. They also have breakfast food in the morning. You can fill a box full of sausages and bacon and pay under 5 bucks!! 

If you want to fulfill your sweet tooth... they have mounds of cakes, cookies and pastries. For the most part the chocolate chip cookies are bomb... although one time i did get a really stale cookie... When im traveling to visit my parents in the valley, i pick up a cake and my family loves them.
author: Jordan C.

description: buy this cake yesterday that today was a special day for my son's birthday cake is old and hard dry impossible to eat very bad experience would not return
author: Angelica L.

description:
We got a 6 inch vanilla chocolate malt cake for my sisters birthday. It was delicious! 

We didn't need to order ahead or anything, but the cake was as fresh as if it had been per ordered 

The cake itself was 22 dollars.
author: Alison L.

description:
1) Beyond STINGY. You can't have a napkin there if you bought your stuff at Falletti. You can't ask for anything, not even a straw. And they're inside Falletti's foods. 
2) Beyond EXPENSIVE. Ridiculous prices. 3-4 times overpriced from already high prices. 
3) DONT BUY ANYTHING FROM HOT BAR. That food is not kept hot or warm. It's only under some lights which is very dangerous. 
4) They have NOTHING gluten free -vegan.
author: Luna M.

description:
This is part of the seamless trio at this location, that is Falletti + Delessio + Peet's.

The food (hot entrees & salad bar) often looks amazing, but the $9.99 per pound price is quite expensive. Just pick a plate to dine-in or a to-go brown box from the shelf next to the hot foods section, and just help yourself to the goodies. Be careful not to fill with too many heavy (water content) salad bar items. Moderation is the key, I was able to assemble a nice variety for around $8. http://media1.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/zILH5LpQ435QlGm8Yb-oSw/l Looks good right? Add a decadent dessert (lemon meringue tart with toasted coconut) for around $3 something, http://media1.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/EcI3-Wg7AJqAqecIGGjywQ/l and I was happy as can be.
author: Luis C.

description:
I love my neighborhood! NOPA NOPA! NOPA!

There is a great selection of hot entrees, salads, and  fine baked goods. Sure, it's a pricey, but manageable just as long as you don't go every week (well, for me at least).

The only real reason I come here is for the Humphry Slocombe ice cream. Who needs to go to the Mission when I can get my Secret Breakfast , Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee, Tahitian Vanilla, etc., ice cream flavors here in my own hood?

Cheers, and see you in line as we all scream for Harry, err :)  Humphry Slocombe Ice cream!
author: Gill C.

description:
Last minute stop for dinner party desert and Delissio came to the rescue!  Tres Leches cake was a hit, as usual.  Visitors from Russia were blown away and already jonesing for another slice.

Thanks D for being there for us!

Great food, never had anything that was not 5 star worthy!  Both locations!
author: Patrick H.

description:
Came here because i was craving Tres Leches. It's a bakery stand in the larger market and i couldn't help myself but pick up a few extra things while i was there. Had the blondie and the lemon cupcake. All were yummy but i was looking forward to the tres leches cake...which was also lovely. The flavors were there, my only complaint was that the cake was not evenly moist with the milk mixture. There were some spots that were melt in your mouth from the milk (my favorite) and there were some that was just cake. 
I'm rating based on the pastries, customer service is a different story. Maybe because it was somewhat early in the morning (10ish) or maybe just because they didn't want to be there, but the staff weren't eager to help us, i think i waited around for a little (when there was someone standing right behind the register) before i finally asked them for help. But the kicker, the one standing behind the register didn't help me, it was the 2nd staff that arrived a few minutes earlier that ended up helping me.
Oh well, if i'm in the area and want dessert i'll stop in.
author: Jennifer P.

description:
Terrible cake. Expensive (For what it is), dry, too much sugary icing. 

Had the Red Velvet cake for my Birthday and found it to be one of the worst velvet cakes I've ever had. Nothing terrible with the actual taste, it was simply too dry, too much icing that was far too sugary it overpowered it, and pricey for the quality.

Absolutely not up to the standards it tries to present itself as a bakery. I'm pretty certain I can bake a better cake and will be doing that in the future.
author: Matt M.

description:
I was a really big fan of their tres leches cake so I ordered the cake for a party. I really talked this cake up so was super disappointed when we cut into it and the cake was runny. Flavors were ok but I couldn't get over it being the consistency of a cake soaked in ice cream. It was refrigerated almost the whole time from when I picked it up until it was served. The slices at the store don't have this problem so not sure if this was a fluke. I definitely wouldn't risk ordering it again. I left a message for the manager who works from the other location but he never called back so now I'm yelping about my disappointment. 

FYI, a pint of Humphry Slocombe is $8 which I thought was expensive until I crazily bought a pint from Bi-rite for $8.99.
author: Mimi L.

description:
The dessert sucks!  It is either too sweet (dulce de leche), bland (bread pudding), dry (cupcakes) or just gross (various old cakes for sale).  

You would be better off eating a Twinkie.  

I've tried almost all of them over the past 3 years thinking that there has got to be something good.  Don't let your eyes fool you!
author: Carb Q.

description:
DO NOT ORDER CAKES FROM HERE.
If you must get a cake here I advise walk in only.
This place has incompetent workers, with terrible customer service. 

I placed a phone order with this company's market street location
to be delivered to Falletti's Delessio bakery on Thursday.
(This was for a cake for my wife's birthday.)

I paid over the phone, and a guy tells me I can pick it up any time Thursday night.
I go in to Falletti's Delessio bakery and they have no record of my order, the other location is already closed, they have no way to access the fact that I've paid.
The cashier calls their usually on-site bakery manager (We'll call him Timmy for this review) and I explain to him what happened...
he basically keeps saying he has no proof/paperwork, like I'm trying to con him.
He suggests that I buy another cake and then be credited when he had access to to the paperwork.
So I buy a second cake there.

(Next day....)

I just got back from walking over to inquire why this happened...and when the cashier calls "Timmy" over and informs him who I am he simply says "so, it was human error. Your order was put in the wrong place."
 
me - "So thats it?"
(waiting for any kind of apology)
Timmy - uhh, did you get some cupcakes last night?

me - "no."

Would you like some?"

"no."

I wanted an apology, but I'll settle for never shopping from this bakery again.
author: Micah M.

description:
On first look, when places are shiny and new to you, there seems to be a decent hot food selection on the self-service counter. Hot and cold sandwiches, even soup is available. Very lovely looking cakes, cookies and pastries are also available. 
 
It's just ok really. Convenient, fast and pretty tasty (like a date with me would be ;). 

I've been going to the one on Broderick since it opened with Falletti Foods.  I used to go there 3-4 times a week, either to pick up dinner, lunch, or a shopper. (just kidding)
Now, I go once a week max. The reason apart from the over-pricing is the food.

The food is a bit boring for repeat customers. Surprise, cats do get bored with the same food every day, man. Thai chicken, pork stew, ribs, limp fries, etc. If I want boring, I'll do the cooking. 
The sweet goodies look better than they taste, no it 's true, try it. Their overly sweet lemon meringue pie will not only pucker your face but your wallet too.  The Fresh Cream on top of these pies is not cream at all, but a topping loaded with stabilizers for a long shelf life. Tastes like a bland shaving cream, yes I've tried it. 

The Tres Leches is very good, and so is the ice cream, actually it is delicious.

I do have a concern with food safety at Delessio. A few months back, a guy was cleaning the grill with a dirty wet towel and no gloves. I asked for a hot Panini. He turned around and started working on my sandwich. He did NOT wash his hands nor did he put on gloves, very dangerous behavior. I politely pointed this out to him and he appeared confused by my request to wash his hands/and or put on gloves. I explained quietly why he should and he complied. WTF.     If I want to get some nasty food illness, I'll scratch my own ass as I prepare dinner, thanks very much.

The temperature of the food is always barely warm, not hot. This is a safety hazard.

I have seen employees, even from the bakery side, walk by the hot food and salad bar and snap up a French fry or tomato without using the utensils provided, just bare hands. Yuck.

The staff is always very helpful and polite, Falletti's could learn from them. 
Thanks to them for making every visit, pleasant. 

That's it.

CM
author: Cheeky Monkey A.

description: Perfectly located across from the DMV, the hot and cold salad bar is perfect for a quick and healthy meal.
author: candide o.

description: (See pics) Review #1320. I saw the Lavazza sign and got all excited, except to find that they did not have an espresso machine and only do drip coffee. So have to cross to the other side to Peets for my soy latte. However, they did have a good selection of pastries.
author: T L.

description:
We came over after lunch at Nopalito, and discovered the bakery inside Faletti's market.  Did a lookee loo, and saw an interesting pastry item, "Rabanada".  Origins are Brazilian.

We decided to give one a try.  It's like a slice of baguette soaked overnight in a custard mixture. Then deep fried and coated with cinnamon sugar.  Very very good.

The staff person behind the counter seemed somewhat annoyed when I asked her if this bakery was the same as the one on Market & Gough.  She recovered; then answered yes.

There's hot food items and boxed cakes and pies and other bakery cakes and pastry items on sale too.
author: Shirley N.

description: Wonderful find in our time in SF. Great  cheeses, beers, and people. Not badly priced for any of the aforementioned, either.
author: Gmarie H.

description:
Good selection, very pricey.

They do have a section where you can grab this and that to pull together a pre-cooked meal. They have a few interesting dessert options. 

I liked the ice cream sandwich selection. It's-It and some Marie's ice cream. The coffee one was delicious. You have to eat it in the wrapper because the chocolate is nice enough that it will melt quickly on contact with the skin.
author: Zack F.

description:
This place claims to close at 9pm but when we went in there at 8:40pm for an ice cream scoop, they wouldn't serve us claiming they close at 8:30. Even though they served a woman right in front of us who also got an ice cream cone. The girl even went and asked some guy in the hot foods and he too claimed they were closing up.
I have worked in food service before and as much as you want to turn away people 15-20 till you actually close-YOU WERE SUPPOSED TO SERVE THE CUSTOMER TILL CLOSING TIME!
DeLessio Market and Bakery in Fallettis Store has bogus closing times!
author: Danielle D.

description:
The Melt.

Not these guys: www.themelt.com

This: Warm house roasted turkey sandwich featuring a cranberry mayo something that was so good I didn't stop to ask whether I should be eating it or not.

Melt in your mouth good.

So good it was gone in no time and unfortunately to late to ask questions.

Or perhaps very fortunately.
author: Jason B.

description:
Opted to grab lunch to go here since I was only a few blocks away. I wasn't really paying attention since I went straight to the salad and hot food bars, but I may have noticed a deli section in the corner. 

Although small compared to the one at Whole Foods, the salad bar had a fairly varied selection of salad greens and other assorted salads (couscous, bean, kale, etc.). The hot food bar mostly consisted of meat dishes (chicken, ribs, turkey meatballs, jumbalaya w/ anduille sausage) with a couple of vegetarian, though not necessarily healthy, options (mac & cheese, potatoes gratin, glazed carrots, polenta cakes). 

I'd say it leans a little on the pricey side, though definitely not outrageously so. My food was pretty good so I'm sure it'll remain a convenient go-to place for lunch.
author: Elsa K.

description:
I think this deli rocks. 

I've had coffee to go, dined in breakfast, look lunch and dessert to Alamo Square, and brought picky visitors here for dinner. 

I always spend more than I mean to, which is partially my fault, and partially the semi-high prices. 

I'm a fan.
author: Dylan ..

description:
I am so glad I don't live close to this place because I'd go broke....quick!  I think their salad bar/hot food bar is about a buck more then Whole Foods and imo while they have less in the way of selection, the meatloaf, mac n cheese and green beans were all amazing!

Their desserts look amazing (I tried the bread pudding w/ blueberries...It was ok, I think it would have been better minus the blueberries) too but their customer service tops it all. And lately that's been real hard to come by...so kudos to you guys ;) for great eats, drinks, specialty items and a great staff to boot.

I will be back for sure....soon!
author: Bella B.

description: I've always picked up amazing cakes and pastries at this bakery. My favorite is malted vanilla and salted Carmel. They also make an amazing tres de leche cake. It's great to have the convenience of prepackaged cakes to take to any party as a gift. My experience has been that they're always fresh and D Lish
author: Tandori J.

description:
We came into Delessio Market & Bakery late on a Saturday night and were really surprised to see some shoppers - perhaps everyone was there for the same reason we were...dessert!

Our first choice for dessert, Candybar, was closed so we decided to hit up the bakery at Delessio for some sweets. After perusing all the different desserts, I went for the bread pudding and my boyfriend went for the tres leches cake. We also picked up a pint of vanilla ice cream, which went perfectly with my bread pudding.

The bread pudding was great - it was filled with cranberries and chunks of chocolate (tastes better if you heat it up a bit!). The tres leches cake was way too sweet for my taste and the frosting on top was overwhelming. 

I think Delessio has a bunch of yummy options for dessert, and also for takeout, but it was a little pricey. $4.25/slice of tres leches cake and $3.50/slice for the bread pudding. Ehhh, not too bad, but not the greatest. Hopefully Candybar is open next time we want dessert!
author: Stephanie C.

description:
This is a great little neighborhood gem. If it were a perfect world, I'd have one of these within walking distance to my home. The market has high quality (albeit pricey) groceries and produce whilst the deli and bakery offers tasty ready-to-eat options. Delicious was the fried and sugared french bread.

There is plenty of free! parking inside the adjoining structure. We especially liked seating options--outdoor on the patio or in a cozy nook by the bakery.
author: Jan P.

description:
Delessio....What happened to you, old friend?

Apparently, Delessio's got made over and became a lot more swanky. Gone are the self-serve dishes that make you feel like you're at a family potluck. You no longer can get a scoop of this and that. Instead you get small fancy, individual cakes that are around $4 each. I used to get a carton of mixed desserts whenever I was in the area. Now I would probably only go there to buy something for a special occasion.

Change sucks.
author: Kym M.

description:
Great baked goods.

I've driven past Delessio many times on my way to 101 and have been meaning to check it out. I finally did today.

I picked up a few things-
mini cupcakes: PB&J, citrus dream, carrot cake
cookies: chocolate chip, oatmeal raisin
made-to-order sandwich: roasted turkey on dutch crunch

Carrot cake was definitely my favorite of the 3 cupcakes. Moist and delicious, it was a perfect little bite of amazingness. Citrus dream was good too, without the whipped cream topping. I also enjoyed the cookies, but at 1.95 each, I thought they were a little pricey. Sandwich had very little turkey and toppings, but dutch crunch roll was great.

They also serve Humphry Slocombe ice cream. Awesome.
author: Sophia B.

description:
Their brazilian french toast is my favorite french toast in the city. It's thicker than the usual cuts and has that granulated sugar crust that gives it all the crunchy sweetness you didn't know you wanted and then realized you were always missing over your eggy toast.

Another favorite is the tres leches cake. So silky and creamy.
author: Aiko S.

description:
It's easy to get carried away in here.  I like how it shares its space with Falletti's and how it's very easy to get to the two confused, both because there's no wall separating them and because they both have Italian names.  The Humphry Slocombe ice cream isn't cheap, but it's delicious.

They need more seating, although it's comfortable sitting outside at the sidewalk tables.  Who knew a view of the DMV parking lot could be so pleasant?
author: John S.

description:
Delessio, you are now OVERPRICED!!!!

I am writing this review with extreme sadness in my heart:  This USED to be my favorite lunch hangout, and now I fear I will never dine here again.

Here's the deal:  the hot & cold salad bars, which generally have delicious dishes to choose from, used to be about $8.50-.75 lb.  This is the upper range of what I'm willing to spend on lunch, but I did it because I loved the variety and found the dishes tasty.

But just a few days ago, I walked into the Market/Valencia St. location and saw that they have suddenly upped the price to $12.50 lb!!!!  They are claiming that this is because they've converted all their food to locally grown and farmed.  Looking around the buffet, the same dishes as always greeted my eyes, except when I tasted my lunch (which rang up at almost $16!!!  I used to pay only about $10-11), it was dried out, overcooked, and told me right off the bat that it'd been sitting around a long time on that buffet.

So, in case my writing's been convoluted and you haven't been able to follow, I'm saying that I just paid a LOT more money for something that tasted far INFERIOR to what I used to get here.

Ugh.

I'm so mad.  And I'm apparently not alone.  I complained about the price hike to the guy who rang me up, and he rolled his eyes and said that they were losing a lot of customers because of it, I wasn't the first to complain by any stretch of the imagination!  I'm glad to know that the rest of the world hasn't lost its mind and decided that it's reasonable to pay much more for the same thing, or as it happens to be, something of lower discernible quality!!!

Delessio, what were you thinking?!!  Do you WANT to go out of business??   Have you NOTICED that there's a recession going on around you, and possibly even a financial depression???

I for one won't be giving Delessio my business anymore.  I felt like I was going to choke on that food for how much it cost!!  It is, in short, ridiculous!!  So, my dear ex-favorite lunch spot, SO LONG AND GOOD LUCK!!!
author: Amy L.

description:
I know that they have a great selection for their supermarket but who cares??

 Since the desert from Delessio's bakery is amazingly good (in my book), 
 they offer one of the best gourmet food (Togo) and best desert in the city!  

  Don't be surprise if you found yourself quitting  going to up scale resturant but coming to get your dinner from Delessio's kitchen instead.
author: Dom G.

description:
Bourgeois.  I was re-acquainted with an old word.  It's much more descriptive than "hipster."  Because that's what hipsters have become: bourgeois.  

This place is really bourgeois.  I got a piece of tres leches cake here.  It cost nearly $4.  It was out in the open amongst all the germs and creepy SF people who like to touch food, taste it, then put it back.  I'm talking about YOU, irresponsible dad with nasty little girl at the hot foods section who let his daughter take a piece of food out of the tray with her hands, take a bite, then put it back into the tray.

The flavor of the cake was way too fancy.  The cake was practically disintegrating under the syrup.  The syrup was much too sticky.  It was a syrup rather than a milk mixture.  It was really really sweet.  And to ruin a bad thing, the whole cake was topped off with a huge dollop of seven minute frosting (aka marshmallow frosting).  Absolutely hideous.  

No, it didn't stop me from stuffing most of it in my face.  Neither did the terrible stomach ache that plagued me for the rest of the night.  Both nights that I ate the cake.  Didn't learn my lesson.  Hoped my stomach was made of iron.  But I surrender to the tres leches cake.  It did the trick.  If by "trick" I meant "made my stomach hurt and not hungry for any type of food."  

I also hate the huge, cumbersome brown paper take-away containers that are designed to make you over-load on self-serve hot foods contaminated by small dirty children.

Hipsters have become the bourgeois.  Don't let it happen to you.
author: Christina C.

description:
Decided it was time to try some new items since I was here to satisfy my Rabanada fix. 

Tried 3 new items :

pancake breakfast mini cupcake $1.95
butter croissant $2.50
tres leches cake $3.95

And of course had to get another piece of rabanada

I really wanted to like the cupcake especially since it's a bite for almost $2. While the yellow cake was dry the maple frosting with crumbled bacon was good. I want to think that  maybe it was dry from sitting. Just don't think I will try again for $2.

The croissant was good: buttery and flaky, but I like them I little darker when they come out of the oven. I would buy again because It's close by, but my preference remains Patisserie Phillipe.

Tres Leches cake was sooo delish with bits of kiwi and pineapple. Oh so moist and oozing with the sweet milk mixture it was soaked in. They only thing I didn't like so much was the meringue top, I did pick up my slice in the evening and the meringue just tasted a little stale. It was a generous slice for $3.95 and will definitely buy again.
author: Maria M.

description:
Delessio has some of the best prepared food in the city. Eons better than Whole Foods. They make all of their food in small batches and they are blooming with flavor. Some of the winners are the macaroni and cheese, roasted broccoli, polenta with tomato jam, wheatberry salad, spetzle, cabbage, their sandwiches are amazing.....

They also have all of the Humphrey Slocumbe flavors available for scoop. 

Their bakery is beyond amazing with mini cupcakes, waffle chocolate, beautiful cakes, cookies, tres leches, etc. 

A great place to fatten up for the winter :)
author: Katherine B.

description:
Tres Leches Cake.

I will drive from all areas of the city just for a slice of this.

I really need to branch out, there are so many mouth-watering selections all around... but I haven't been able to do so just yet.
author: Tamara N.

description: All of the "hot" food was room temperature, easily in the danger zone for food borne illness and would get someone sick; they would not pass a food inspection.  Upon complaining to the Chef, his response was that he cooks everything earlier in the day so it doesn't stay hot! Neither him nor the cashier could care less when I told them they were going to get people sick.  I had 5 different choices on my plate, all room temp.  Threw them straight in the garbage.  I could not believe how both staff members just didn't care at all. Unbelievable.
author: N T.

description:
We finally made it to the second Delessio Market in San Francisco. This newest location is nicer, but not as big as the Market St. location, but they also serve the same hot and cold food in their systematic self-serve way. (Any new location has to be nice, DUH!!)

We came here for a sweet treat for the kids and the two items that caught their young eyes are their Butterscotch pudding and the Double Chocolate pudding. The $4.25 pudding comes in a small cup and became a instant favorite for them. They enjoyed it so much that they asked daddy to buy two more (one flavor each) for their snacks later on. Another item that caught their attention is the Banana Foster Cheesecake. Kids enjoyed this place so much, there is no doubt they will get this $27.00 cheesecake very soon. And since we're here, we or Matt bought wifey a $9.00 roast-beef sandwich for her lunch. The kids wants to come back and try the hot-food very soon.
author: Matt G.

description:
Someone with a sweet-tooth as big as mine should NOT live within walking distance to a place like Delessio.  

The cupcakes here are divine, and creating a selection of the mini ones makes for great birthday gifts or surprises for friends--especially when you don't know their flavor preferences.

On another note, I haven't seen it here, but the bread pudding from Delessio is out of this world.

Best of all: you can get Humphrey Slocombe ice cream here!!! (Yes, that *does* merit three exclamation points.)

...Nothing better than a scoop after a rough afternoon at the DMV (a block away)--then you can walk it off along the panhandle (two blocks away) and into GG park. :)
author: Brianna H.

description:
Surprisingly, this place has got the goods! ..  mouthwatering warm food and salad bar (though I recommend arriving early for the freshest servings), and a pastry/dessert selection that pretty much leaves you wanting to try everything they've got. 

I just picked up a Buche de Noel (yule log cake) on Christmas Eve and, for $40, it was perfect.. and delicious; one of the richest, most perfectly delicious cakes I've ever had.

By the way, Delessio is attached to Faletti Foods - an upscale small-batch gourmet grocer (and everything at both establishments is priced accordingly); Faletti is also attached to a Peet's Coffee (on the other side). It's almost kind of hard to tell where Faletti stops and Delessio starts, once you're inside, but it's such a great fit that it really doesn't matter. Good food abounds under this roof.

Oh, and when I came in to pick up the Buche last week, I noticed their Brazilian French Toast - sitting there behind glass, right near the register. I wasn't even as hungry as I was curious. It seemed rather funny-shaped and coated in shimmering crystals.. and it had an exotic name, so I just had to.. And damn! I'm so glad I did.. sweet bread soaked in cream overnight (I think there was some rum involved?) and then deep fried and rolled in sugar.. There's probably more to it  than that, but I'll leave the specifics to the good folks at the Delessio counter. I'm going to stop by and pick one up tomorrow morning though.. so yeah, don't go buying them all up or anything. Or if you do, can you please bring me one (yes, I'm serious). Thanks!
author: Dimitri H.

description:
Tres leche cake = cavity cake

My sister will eat it. And she's a dentist.
author: Judy L.

description:
I've been wanting to go to Delessio Market & Bakery for a long time, my friend drove me over here.  Once I ordered a Chocolate Tower Cake and it was awesome.

This time I got 2 mini cupcakes at $1.75 ea.  Both were pretty good: one had peanut butter & meringue on top (very pretty) & the other was a nutella one w/ hazelnuts on the top.

Also got some salami: Boccalone Suppressata at $22.95 a lb only got .09 oz and it was $2.07.  Also got Boccalone Capocollo at $24.99 only got .13 oz total was $3.25

There is also a salad bar & other cooked foods, sandwiches, cakes, tarts, & more desserts.

Recommended.
author: Ann L.

description:
I found this place on a discussion board discussing the best place to get tres leches cake in san fran. And that's exactly what I went here for. I didn't eat anything else (besides the white chocolate bubble wrap, which i can emphatically NOT recommend), but my friends seemed to be pretty impressed with their food. 

Now on to the tres leches cake. I wasn't expecting a whole lot, from a deli attached to a supermarket. And I've had a rash of disappointing tres leches cakes lately. But this one blew me away. Don't get me wrong, it's not the best out there, but a significant cut above the mediocre masses. It's a self-serve setup, and when I got to the tres leches I saw a rather unimpressive display of two lonely pieces of not moist enough tres leches cake. As I served it up to my to go box, it fell into three pieces, which I then had to scoop into the box. But as it fell apart, I noticed that despite the lack of milk surrounding the cake, it was super moist. 

And then when I tasted it, I was rewarded with an amazingly good tres leches cake. Very moist and sweet, and perhaps a touch of another flavor I can't put my hands on. I'd give this tres leches cake an 8/10.
author: Chad C.

description:
Okay, first off, I *want* to like Delessio's.  I've told myself that their mac and cheese is delicious...even though it's gotten blander and blander with each visit.  

Today I went in for said mac and cheese to find they were out, but working on a fresh batch.  Excellent! I busy myself until it's ready, purchasing a little sample bag of that intriguing chocolate bubble wrap while I wait.

So I settle down with my lunch and decide to cheat by nibbling on this bubble wrap before the real food and OHMYFUCKINGGOD, this shit is disgusting.  Not just meh, not just okay, but "I will finally make a yelp profile just to express my disdain for this chocolate that made me want to vomit" kind of bad.

The offending flavor was white chocolate with lime and sea salt.  I've wanted to try this enticing combo since I first stepped into Delessio a month ago.  It was horrid. Waaay too salty, sickeningly so.  I tried the other flavors (peanut butter with coffee beans, dark chocolate with crisp rice, white and dark chocolate with cocoa nibs) with the latter being the only palatable one.  At $24.95 this stuff ought to be heaven in my mouth.  Instead I used today's bland mac (what happened to the sourdough bread crumbs they used to top it with?) to get the taste out of my mouth.

Next time, I'll stick with Vosges; their bars are worth the price tag, and I wouldn't take chocolate bubble wrap if they were handing it out for free.
author: Allie J.

description:
They've remodeled since my last review and based on being overwhelmed with their outstanding food yet again the other day I thought I'd "second" my review from 2010 - they are improved on what seemed like "difficult to improve" offerings from back then.  

I read through some of the other reviews and didn't understand the "pricey" remarks - one of the many things I really like is that since you serve yourself you have great control over the price and variety of your selections.  I really appreciate that aspect and hope they keep it forever.  A foodie's dream...

Great coffee, great salads, great meals, great sandwiches, great desserts - and then there's the stuff I haven't even tried yet.

Their Cuban sandwich - I wouldn't know how to begin to describe it - but I've been known to drive probably 80 miles to get one...
author: Etienne E.

description:
I had a 20% off coupon from GZ, plus the fact that it's 2 blocks from home made it impossible for me to stay away.

Must try: chocolate bubble wrap. They have all kinds of flavors. At the check out counter, they have a bag with samples of 3 different kinds (peanut butter/chocolate, milk chocolate, white chocolate with coconut and ginger). You have to try these! They're really good and the presentation is original, which makes it fun to eat.

The brownie bites are really good, great for bite-sized cravings for chocolate and are chewy. I don't like brownie bites that have already hardened and are stale.

Cupcakes: Citrus dream and PB &J. I can't decide which one I liked best. They're both so different and special in their own way (just like the 7 dwarves).

Total bill (including 20% off): $15.44
author: Alyssa G.

description:
I would be a big fan of this place if they could just come up with $10 or less meal with a sandwich & side. I'm always frustrated that I have to buy stuff by pounds, and have it be overpriced. For awhile they had $10 meal deal which was a great value and then it disappeared. Bring it back!

Otherwise, most of the stuff I'd rather get & cook for cheaper in Falletti itself. If they had more ready-made stuff for quick meals, at a better price, I think it could be a big hit in an underserved neighborhood.
author: Ryan H.

description:
Wow, its like being a little kid in a candy store. Yesterday was my first time shopping at Delessio and i always drive by on my way home. I was craving for cupcakes so i made an impromptu trip to Delessio. Good thing i did because my goodness, their bakery is filled with delicious goodies! chocolates bars? bread pudding? mini cupcakes? scones? AND MORE! i ended up purchasing 4 mini cupcakes ($1.75 each), they were tiny but filled with icing goodness. 

Next time, ill come back and try their rotisserie section! Also, kudos to the cashier who was really helpful and informed me the cupcakes are REALLY GOOD.
author: Carol Y.

description:
When I feel like pretending to be a rich foodie, but really only have about $13 to spare, I'll head to Delessio.

"Food porn for the eyes" is my phrase of choice for this upscale-ish market. Everything from the Bubble Wrap Chocolate - SERIOUSLY; BUBBLE WRAP CHOCOLATE! to the gourmet cakes on display, to the selection of drankz, to the fried chicken looks so incredibly mouth-watering that I could probably cause a flash flood if I dared to open my mouth.

Unfortunately, I've only sampled the sandwiches (delish! I recommend the chicken bacon something-or-other) and the chocolate cookie. Both were fantastic. 

It's so hard returning to a culinary diet of Kraft and Morningstar Farms after a visit to Delessio :( Sigh... a poor girl can dream.
author: Leslie W.

description: Not sure why this place is still in business. Saw a shopping cart parked outside, the owner of which is asleep at a table inside. No hot food, "chef" talking on his cell phone, oblivious clerks. If they don't care anymore they should just close.
author: V. R.

description: This is probably one of favorite places to grab lunch before my shift starts.  I love their "Thai" grilled chicken.  I just wished they had different types of rice instead of just "Spanish" rice.
author: A L.

description:
My go to place when I can't figure out what to eat!  This place reminds me of Whole Foods on a smaller scale - but fits the bill since it's up the street from my work.  I've been working in this area for almost 4 years so they have to be doing something right if this is my go to choice of the many food spots here in the NOPA.

Their cold food section is awesome - salad bar with lots of fresh cut carrots, cucumbers, lettuce, spinach, radish, diced or shredded chicken, chopped hard boiled eggs - what more could you ask for? I was and still am crave their grilled eggplant but for the last 2 months I have not seen it available.

I must admit their hot food section though is amazing - they need to add new dishes to their selection. I'm a little burnt out with their tofu dish, mac and cheese, meat loaf etc... I will however always go for their broccoli which is one of my fav dishes.  

I also love their dessert section - for any one of my employees' birthdays we pick up a cake for them.  My two hands down favorite cakes are the German Chocolate and the the Yellow Cake with Chocolate Frosting (I can't remember the name at the moment) but you'll know what I am talking about when you see it - it's one of their most popular cakes! [ it's square with a rose on top]  Their array of cookies, pastries and mini cupcakes are delicious and dangerous! I have to purposely not look in that direction which is hard because that is where you end up paying for your food and making that last impulse decision to give in to all their sweets! (not necessarily a bad thing)

Lastly, they also offer "Humphry Slocombe" a SF based ice cream spot that donates a portion to SF schools - which I am in total support of.  My favorite is the blue bottle infused! Yummm! Again - another reason why I have this love/hate relationship with their dessert area. :)
author: Caroline C.

description:
I have to say Delessio and Faletti's have a good thing goin' on here. Ingenious! First you can do your shopping and then eat at Delessio's afterward, which is great to schedule together. It gives a whole new meaning to shopping while you're hungry. And it also makes for a good lunch date. Don't get me wrong, dropping some cash on groceries and then spending another 10-15 bucks each on lunch doesn't make for the most economical trip to the grocery store, but it definitely is the most delicious. 

Delessio has a great assortment of cheeses that they are more than happy to talk to you about while they give you multiple samples to try. The staff are all passionate about the food they serve. One of the gals at the cheese counter told me that she made a pizza the night before out of rinds from 3 different cheeses. If that isn't cheesey love, I don't know what is! They also have a dizzying array of almost unreal looking desserts. I mean, I could stand there for hours watching those desserts turn in the case. 

Best of all, I love going into a place where they recognize you each time you come back. (ok, i've been there A LOT!) Each time we discover another new cheese or meat and go home having eaten 6 or 7 new delicious items. They also use compostable utensils and encourage customers to use their recycling/compost bins. Think Whole Foods has good by-the-pound choices? Delessio takes deli to the next level. I give them five stars for the awesome staff, great selection, and getting a cheap-ass to spend a little more on something gourmet.
author: Kira R.

description: It's not that this place has a great bakery and sandwich--it's that the owner has now OVER charged me three different times--never an employee, but always the owner.  Instead of 'cancelling the transaction' and starting over--he offers me COOKIE!!  Well, this third time does it for me--not planning to return.  If you do go--make sure you carefully review your check.
author: michael a.

description:
No More.  No More.  No More.  

These were the words I uttered under my breath while walking the block to my apartment from Delessio today.  I just don't understand why the cashiers at this place can't deign themselves to be polite.  I don't need you to offer to walk my purchase home for me, but a simple "thanks," or even a "hello" would suffice.  Not once NOT ONCE have any of the cashiers working this little counter said a word to me other than my total price.  And, because my patronage (which, til now has been pretty regular) isn't appreciated, I will no longer go.

Overpriced, and ungrateful.  Up yours, Delessio.

* Disclaimer* My husband agrees about the cashiers, but wanted me to point out that the folks behind the deli and cheese counters are usually really cool.  So okay.
author: Jessica H.

description:
so i walk here like twice a week during my lunch breaks now in search of kona cofee bread pudding. the guy at the counter informed me that the pastry men only really make that one when good fruits aren't in season. WHACK! anyway, i've since tried the lemon blueberry bp and it's good. and the raspberry chocolate one...uhhh amazing! kona coffee still has my heart though.

so i pick up a chocolate croissant and the guy at the counter tells me that i will indeed be back for more. "you're going to love it. you'll be back," are his exact words. it's got chocolate mixed in with crushed almonds so it's more like a paste if you will. not like those stupid hard sticks of chocolate within buttery croissant yumminess you get everywhere else. that was a plus. but goodfellow at the counter, WRONG! i will NOT be back for the chocolate croissant. it was good but nothing close to the chocolate hazelnut croissant at Bay Bread/La Boulange. i will be back in search of some kona coffee bread pudding for sure though.
author: Regina C.

description:
After a nice meal at Beretta, we decided to grab dessert from one of our favorites. Delissio did not disapoint!

So I have a cupcake fetish and OMFG did they taste amazing. The Boston Cream Pie was a delicious sugar overdose. There was also Viennese chocolate cupcake with the cake part made to taste and feel like brownie. I about died when I bit in. Seriously, it was that good.  

 Also, the Humphry Slocombe ice cream is pretty damn rich. I love the malted milk chocolate. I wish I would have gone with a pint. Top the night off with some tres leches cake and this was absolute perfection. Everything here amazing with something for everybody to love.
author: Jeff C.

description:
Oh WOW! 
I really can't even tell you what items I got from here....as I did a whirlwind shopping spree through the bakery ... don't even debate which items to get....just get them ALL like I did!  

Rest assured you'll be smitten with every item (from the tiny cupcakes to the big giant cinnamon looking roll) ....and overall a heavenly experience :)
author: Lee M.

description:
I love this place!! When ever I don't feel like cooking and want something fast, I always stop by the hot food bar. Everything is rich and filling so it doesn't take much to satisfy me. Their selection of pastries and desserts are great too and now they have ice cream!!. 

The only thing I have not liked are the cupcakes. I've had them twice and have thought they were awful.
author: Rolo A.

description: Delessio is part bakery, part prepared food bar, part meat counter, part market, part coffee-shop. Or maybe it's just me and I can't tell where Delessio ends and Falletti Foods market begins. I came here for dessert hopping to try some pastries and had to take them to-go since there is very limited seating - not enough for a party of ten people. I got two of every mini cupcake to share with my friends. Each of the cupcakes were beautiful and stacked with creamy frosting and dreamy toppings. We tried the salted caramel, orange creamsicle, boston cream pie, red velvet, peanut butter chocolate. and something else that was scarfed down by others too quickly for me to sneak in a bite. Everyone loved the mini cupcakes and craved more! I'll have to come back again to enjoy a round of mini cupcakes for myself! They also serve Humphry Slocombe ice cream but none of the exciting new flavors, but still good for pairing with the rich cakes. I also stole a big bite of my friend's Brazilian french toast which was unexpectedly moist and deliciously airy and covered in a sweet glaze and powdered sugar. It was so good, like a taste of breakfast in heaven. I will definitely return for some more of that Brazilian french toast!
author: Rita N.

description:
Since I'm the head of the fun committee at work, Delessio has become my go-to cake source, specifically for the tres leches cake.  It's my favorite and it's often requested for birthdays.

I've had the chocolate tower a few times and it is quite ugly to cut, especially in front of people.  There are shards of wasted chocolate EVERYWHERE.  And to be honest, the actual cake is pretty dry and the butter cream bland.  I feel the same about the chocolate raspberry cake and lemon decadence cake.

The variety of baked goods is impressive; however, the hot food is quite expensive- for what it is.

Lastly, on a few occasions, my cake ordered by phone was lost, but they were able to find my credit card #?!
author: Teena O.

description:
This place is proof that the Gods want us to be happy. This is also proof that when you reach for your wallet to pay for everything you ever would want from this place, you would also hear the Gods laugh. All of them.

Excellent cheeses, from sheep to goats to cows, check,
Meats of all sorts, from salami made by "imported" Italians to spreadable salami, check.
Delectable cakes that beg you from the shelf to eat them, check,
A wounded bank account, check.
A dazzled and titillated palate, check.
A place that the Gods have blessed in every possible way, check.
A place that the Gods will make you shop until you say no mas, check.

Checkmate, my friends. Give it up. Give in to this place. It's the most amazing place I've been to in a long time. How strange and wonderful that it's a bakery and a deli. The Gods are kind when they want to be. Don't even think about disagreeing.
author: Alex L.

description:
Okay- the five stars is not for the food. It's not for the selection, not for the prices, and certainly not for the store layout.

5 + stars is for Tuffy, the manager.

If you want the best service in the city, then come here. It's not based on recognition of repeat customers- everyone is treated well. If I had an award to offer one person in the country who exemplifies perfect service, it would be the manager of Delessio. 

As I mentioned in my first review, I've seen her pay out of her pocket when someone couldn't afford their food! Tuffy gives out samples, urges you to try everything, and gives gratis like you're dining in her living room. She's knowledgeable, helpful without ever being pushy, and terribly likable. I don't think anyone would have trouble enjoying a short, "how are things?" convo with her. Plus, she seems sincerely interested in her customers' well being. 

What inspires me to say all this? Well, I moved to DC about 6 months ago, but am back in SF for a short period of time. Before I had left San Francisco, I was a semi-regular customer. When I went to Delessio today- she asked me why she hadn't seen me around! I was like, "Damn! You are goooood!"

As for the food- love their chocolate chip cookies if they're fresh, but everything else is hit or miss.
author: Amanda C.

description:
I have to agree with my mom, Heila D. on this one- Delessio's prepared food is ridiculously greasy, EVERY TIME!  Literally oil-slick grease layers whatever dish you put any of their prepared foods in.  I can feel the lard forming on my thighs as I take every bite when I eat here.  And no, you would think that grease=good, but surprisingly that is not the case here.  It's like they literally pour half a cup of canola oil over every prepared dish.

I haven't tried their desserts, but I have to admit that they do look very good.  Expensive, but they look well made.  And, they have a small array of fine cheeses to choose from as well.  Come here if you don't have time to hit up Whole Foods.  Other than that, you can get the same stuff that will taste better and is cheaper at Whole Paycheck.  Sorry, but it's true.
author: Genevieve M.

description:
The staff at Delessio were absolutely over-the-top helpful & friendly, to the point where I was almost taken aback by it. It's not that this town doesn't have helpful & friendly people in it, it's just that I've become accustomed to a certain kind of SF-aloofness with my bar/restaurant service. You get to feeling like a number on a list. But the staff at Delessio were friendly & engaging. They definitely seem to love working there.

Oh, & the mini cupcakes I brought to my friend/former-roommate's potluck birthday party were expensiveish, yes, but delicious & extremely well received (mostly by me, because I honestly didn't want to share them with anyone else).

I will most definitely be back.
author: Pete J.

description:
I'll save you the pontification about how the neighborhood fought for this kind of tenant mix in the Broderick Place development, and simply say, DeLessio fucking rules.

I have a friend who lives across the street (YES RIGHT ACROSS THE STREET YOU LUCKY TRAMP!) and it makes for good times, because nothing goes better with two hours of Project Runway like cheddared polenta with tomato jam, Israeli couscous zucchini salad, tres leches cake, and two of the best chocolate chip cookies ever made. Also, according to the local expert on the foods of the Latin Caribbean, DeLessio's Cuban pork pannini hot sandwich is a more reasonable facsimile of a cuban sandwich than anywhere else on this godforsaken coast. 

There is nothing like artfully prepared, dynamite-tasting rich foods to help you appreciate the beauty of your existence.
author: Megan W.

description:
I love all the things about this Delessio that I love about the other one. Quality, selection, mac n cheese. Above all else I love that I can try a little bit of anything! 

That said, I simply cannot afford to eat here regularly. If they have indeed raised their prices because they are going all-organic and local, good on them. That is important to me and I do understand that cheap food comes at a cost, etc etc. However. I will have do do my own cooking for lunch most of the week to be able to pay these folks to cook for me once or twice a a week.
author: Emily H.

description:
Sure, they have a full spread of desserts, but they have hot and cold buffets as well.  

After a neighborhood restaurant told us basically they didn't have any of the food on their menu, we walked over to Delessio to see what was available.  The nice thing about a hot food take-out is that everything you see is cooked and ready  to go.  No menu mismatches.  Just put it in a box and pay $9.93 a pound.  

We picked up some salad, Thai chicken, long green beans, kale and cabbage, polenta, and ham quiche.  2 of us filled up for $18.38.  There were tables and chairs inside, napkins and compostable potato starch utensils, with an odd 1950s station on the sound system.  

Compostable potato starch utensils.  Will we start calling these potatoware?
author: David D.

description:
They absolutely do make the best chocolate chip cookies...Oatmeal Chocolate Chip. Soft, gooey, delicious, It's like crack for babies. 

After buying lunch, as an afterthought, of I almost forgot this bag of cookies. 

I approach the counter to buy them. 

Cashier: "That will be six forty five please."

Me: "I think these are the best cookies ever, don't you think so?"
(cashier sarcastically glares back)

Me: " I guess you're sick of hearing that."

Cashier: (says honestly) "Yeah, I kinda am." (smiles)

Me: " I understand, there are certain things I get asked a lot all the time ."

Me: " I know! You know what? Would this make it better? Dude, these are the shittiest cookies I ever had. But for some damn reason I keep coming back for these shitty cookies."

Cashier: (laughs) "Don't tell the chef about that." (points to pastry chef working busily in the background, fussing with a sheetcake)

Me: Good I've made you laugh, now I'm gonna go get some milk to go with my shitty cookies. 

Cashier: (laughs again) "You're cute, hope you have a good day."

Yes. These are the shittiest cookies I ever had. 

Go to Delessio's and be disappointed.
author: J A.

description:
I'm in sandwich heaven...let me rave about the Delessio meatloaf sandwich.  Contrary to other reviewers, the bread (a thin foccacia) was not soggy.  The sandwich was perfectly constructed.  Let me explain.

(1) Bread was thin and chewy.  A lot of places give you too much bread or bread that's too thick.  The proportion of fillings to bread is very important.  They understand this.
(2) Flavors meld.  I had their roast beef sandwich too.  I get the feeling that they've given a lot of thought to providing the right cheese and condiments.  With the meatloaf sandwich, the cheese is mild and the tomato sauce is tangy.  There isn't too much mayo.  The fresh basil is such a nice touch.
(3) Quality ingredients.  Fresh basil.  Moist meatloaf, thickly sliced.
(4) Height of sandwich is manageable.  It's tall enough that you have to open wide but not so tall that it's impossible to bite into.
(5) Construction holds up.  The sandwich does not drip or fall apart.

The vanilla creamsicle mini cupcake was a perfect dessert.

Also, their brisket is out of this world.  No, it's not a place for dieters, but the food is really, really good.
author: Lolia S.

description:
Someone mangled the name of this place so I thought they were trying to say "delicioso" which would be a cheesey name for anything food related.  Stupid names make me not want to go to places.

Luckily, we were nearby and I saw from the sign on the window that it was really Delessio.  That's acceptable.  It was about 4pm and we were hungry but we had dinner plans at 8:30 so we didn't want to eat too much.  There were lots of options like mac n cheese, rotisserie chickens, salads, desserts and deli meats.  We opted for the cuban sandwich and it was delicious.  Juicy pork and ham with melted cheese and some kind of aioli on a nice roll.  It might've been heavy for one person but it was great between two.

I also picked up a lactose and dairy free coffee chocolate ice cream that I tried later after dinner.  I know it doesn't sound right but it was really good and my stomach did not hurt me.
author: Seong P.

description:
Okay I am so excited to review Delessio because it has been a LONG TIME COMING.  A little backstory for ya:

Back in December I went to an Elite event in the Mission at an art gallery/lounge place (forgive me, I'm blanking on the name...but that really wouldn't be fair to promote another place on this review, now would it?) So anyway... like all the Elite events, there were a number of different vendors there offering a wide array of food, desserts, drinks etc. One of them was our lovely Delessio.  They had samples of the Boston Cream Pie, Tres Leches Cake, and Tiramisu (I think). 

The moment the Tres Leches entered my mouth, I was IN LOVE.  I'm not kidding!! I turned to my friends and said, "Okay, I will disown you both if you don't buy me this cake for my birthday next year!"

Now, fast forward 8 months to August (my special birthday month). I'm sure my friends have forgotten about my request oh so many months ago, but I didn't let that stop me.  I went and put in an order for my own birthday cake.  And I had no shame because I have been dreaming of that DAMN CAKE! 

And oh yes, it was all that I loved and remembered!  Delessio, you made my birthday this year! Thank you! :)
author: Candice M.

description:
What is management thinking?  Raise prices to the point they drive daily customers away.  Well that's what they did with me.  

I used to hit the store several times a week and now its way too expensive, for the prices they charge I rather go to Whole Foods (can't wait for the Whole Foods to open in the Haight).

I support the concept of buying only local products and sustainability but thats a poor excuse for hiking the prices.

The only up side is the cheese and salami selection, when they go I am gone.
author: G R.

description:
i don't understand how you can dis Delessio. I love it so much that I'm honestly not interested in knowing you if you don't like it.  

Here's the thing: I do not cook. I don't. My apt has a beautiful kitchen with my housemates' lovely cookware from Williams Sonoma, but I just don't have the patience & I don't care. When I cook, it is an EVENT, not an every day thing. Anyway, Delessio is pretty much my saving grace and if you play your cards right, you can get out of here spending less than 10 dollars. Just utilize the smaller boxes. You don't need that much mac & cheese anyway.  

I usually grab a protein, some veg, a tiny container of mac & cheese & a cookie (goddamn, the chocolate chip cookies here are the fucking best), if I'm feeling sassy.  Everything I've had is usually really good and this one Saturday morning, I wandered in and they had fried chicken, and I was looking at it so lustily that the very sweet lady that works there gave me a nice sample and I swear my entire perception of life changed. 

God, I love this place.
author: Maria D.

description:
Maybe four stars on a regular day but today I happened to be well into the black hole of PMS and that sugary buffet of sweets they had on display was enough to give me a visual sugar fix. I left with one small treat and I was more than satisfied. It's pretty amazing when the sights and smells of magnificent sweets are enough to pacify an hysterical premenstrual nut job jonesing for an entire chocolate cake and a side of creme brulee. 

I also happen to be an UNfan of the DeLessio on Market and this outpost knocks their presentation out of the park. Everything here looks more appetizing, seems more lovingly made, and is honestly easier to identify because it doesn't look all Moulin-Rouge inside this shop (the Market Street store is awfully dark). 

I already liked Falletti but now I think I might be in love.
author: Autumn K.

description:
Delessio and Falletti, with Peet's attached - let's hear it for double letters!

After discovering how much I liked Falletti market, I had to go back to try Delessio for take-out.  I am SO glad that I did.

First of all, just like I said in my review for Falletti, parking is ridiculously easy.  I may never brave the jacked-up parking garage underneath Whole Foods on California again.

Secondly, neither the grocery store nor the take-out is very crowded.  No "take a number" system here.  You get your to-go box or boxes, go to the end of the line, and fill them with what ever you want and how much of it you need.  Everything in the line costs the same, so none of that crazy math stuff needed (impossible after 6pm).  

I bought a whole roast chicken, some mac & cheese, and some brisket.  My total came to $28 for the equivalent of dinner for 2 for 2 nights (including a little bit of leftover salad I had at home).  I guess that would also be considered dinner for 4,  but like I said, I don't do that crazy math stuff after 6pm.  I was in and out in just under 15 minutes, which will probably be shortened next time since it will no longer be my first time.

The chicken was well flavored and moist, with the meat falling off of the bone.  The brisket was tender and had a great sweet/savory sauce on the top - delicious.  And the mac & cheese was just right - it had something special in it like nutmeg to give it a wonderful, adult flavor.

Comfort-food to go.  I LOVE it.

I will definitely go back to Delessio, especially since I have yet another section of the store I want to try - dessert!
author: Liz S.

description:
This is a true story (TRUE STOREEEE) about one girl who went on date with a guy that DIDN'T like cheese!!!

Honestly though....This is number 10 on the List of Requirements for my guy.  It wasn't even on the list before I went on said date!  He wasn't even lactose intolerant...he just didn't like it.  How is that even possible!!  NOT liking cheese!!  He was cray-cray. 

Delessio's triggered the Anti-Cheese Boy flash back today.  Macaroni and Cheese, Potatoes Au Gratin, Tomato, Cucumber Feta Salad, Polenta with Parmesan!!  I loaded a carton up with Mac and Cheese and went home happy to sit my lazy ass on the couch to carbo and fat load.  MMMmmm......sooo goood.  I love cheese.

Thank god I kicked his ass to the curb and didn't ever call him back after the first date...it would have been a disaster. Besides..he had facial hair.  Another no-no.
author: Jay H.

description:
Oh. My. Goodness.

I'm speechless. I asked my girlfriend to bring me back a sandwich on her way back from Brunch. She stopped at this place and brought me the most godly of sandwiches ever devised: a red snapper po'boy.

Words can not describe my feelings for this sandwich. I'm not even going to try. What I will say is that I'm extremely full and it has been hours since I had the sandwich, but I still crave it. I may go back for dinner I want one so badly.
author: Jordan M.

description:
My boyfriend got me the chocolate fudge birthday cake from here.  All my guests were so impressed with how beautiful the cake was...it's truly a statement cake.  Cutting into it was took a lot of muscle power, but one bite was so divine.  It looks sweeter than it is...wasn't too sweet, which was perfect.  Love my perfect birthday cake :-)

Quite expensive, but my boyfriend gets nothing but the best for me.  Love him!
author: Annie S.

description:
Lends a much needed gourmet boon to the neighborhood. There are a number of hidden gem food spots in this section, but Delessio's market just throws it all over the edge. 

This is the second Delessio market and, just like with the first (at Haight and Market down by Flax), the strength and quality of the food is so good that it's likely to draw a crowd that will help to single-handedly alter the ethos of the neighborhood. 

"HEALTH" FOOD... NOT.
Ignats P is right - the hot food bar is a heart attack waiting to happen, but, man, what a way to go. The potatos au gratin are outstanding.

THE PRIGS HAVE IT
One question, though... is it an absolute requirement at the Delessio Markets that the sandwich guys have to be prigs? When I've been to either locale and bought a sandwich I feel like I've been putting the sandwich guy out or something merely by asking for the hot pannini or what have you. And I know it's not just me. I've seen the sando guy literally roll his eyes at a customer's simple request that the sando guy pass over a pre-made sandwich. Is this treatment supposed to be European or something?
author: Hannah Q.

description:
It's a Falletti Foods and a Delessio all smooshed together, and there's a peets in there too. I'm all confused.

But the bread pudding and the 'bubble wrap' chocolate with peanut brittle are AMAZING. that much is clear to me now.
author: matthew r.

description:
Yesterday I played DD for a group of friends who ate some laced carrot cake. 

After a really delightful couple of hours of blissful languidity at Dolores, we headed over to GGP to see the Jug Band Festival (holy god I love San Francisco). En route, we stopped at Delessio's to get a picnic lunch.

I wholeheartedly recommend setting loose and watching a handful of stoned people wonder around the self-serve islands here. You'd think they were at the Wonka Factory sans the slave labor. 

After less than half an hour of putting various kinds of foods into various boxes, they were all very, very proud of themselves for making such rapid-fire menu selections (they basically took a bit of everything).
author: jason l.

description:
DO NOT ORDER ANYTHING AHEAD OF TIME HERE.
I used to order platters here ALL THE TIME. For about two years. But it's gone way downhill-the ONLY reason they get even ONE star is that the manager or owner or whoever he is was so nice, named Bob or Bobby, and really knew how to listen to my complaints and offer condolences/coupons for another time to make up for the mistakes.
I'm the kind of person who names names if I think the staff member should be held accountable for messing up. So here it is. I wrote down his name and everything, that's how rude and idiotic he was. I think he's a cook (the jacket) or something, but then why is he taking orders for cakes?
Fernando. Short guy, very tense and irritated. Took a cake order like he had somewhere else to be, he didn't even take my address down when I wanted a delivery, I had to ask HIM to take down my phone number. CRAZY! 
Then the day of my big party. NO DELIVERY. I call, get put on hold. Call again, get hung up on, call AGAIN and this guy says he doesn't have record of it.
a friend had to get a cake at Safeway! I go into the store the next day, super upset, and who do I see?? this FERNANDO guy!
I ask him as calmly as possible, "Do you remember me?" and I explain the mess-up. He says no, can you hold on? and he just WALKS AWAY. It's WASN"T BUSY, they were just trying to close and get out of there or something. So that's when I demand his name and just leave.
I came into the grocery store again, determined to never buy from DeLessio again, but I see Bob, whose face I've seen there for years.
I explain the situation, he apologizes profusely, is SO NICE that I'm actually HAPPY by the end of the discussion, and I even buy a couple of tarts, (he gives me a few cookies for free too!) He understands this business. For the low price of a few cookies and a very friendly positive attitude he was able to ALMOST get back a severely disgruntled customer.
I don't know why they are letting incompetent, bad-attitude cooks take cake orders, but it's a big mistake. They lost me for pre-ordering cakes and dinner food forever. Sad. I used to like their lasagna and polenta chili thing. (though those are worse tasting now too. SALTY AND FATTY, maybe this Fernando guy is cooking them too, eh?)
Sorry, Sometimes employees make mistakes, but this guy. Twice? And a bad attitude all over. He acts friendly but he completely ignores your needs as a customer.
author: Kim W.

description:
Best use of time while waiting for my number at the DMV! Delicious food and the manager Bobby is pretty damn nice.
so good, so good, so good.
Delessio's + close to panhandle= less cranky DMV experience or better yet, best place to go before a picnic!
author: Allegra W.

description: I checked early in the week to request a FRESH large German Chocolate Cake for Friday. They told me it would be in Friday at 2pm. I called after 2pm on Friday and specifically asked if they had received a FRESH GCCake. They said 'yes'. I ran over to the store and was only then told that no GCCake had arrived that day and the cake I wanted was two days old. With guests arriving shortly I was in a position where I had to purchase a substandard cake. Though it may be tasty, for my standard of entertaining it was not worh $32.95.
author: Blair C.

description:
I am a lucky, lucky girl. Was recently the recipient of desserts from Delessio's and all I can say is holy cow, how did I not know of this place before? 

So all you men out there, if you really want to knock the socks off a girl, this is definitely the way to go.  I got to try an amazing meringue concoction (a crispy perfectly baked meringue disc topped with tart-sweet lemon curd and a sprinkling of fruit) and an awe-inspiringly decadent chocolate cake filled with a rich vanilla cream that tasted like it had a hint of moscarcpone blended in.  I stopped in the next day to see what else was on offer, and picked up a couple of cupcakes that most definitely did not survive more than a couple of blocks before being devoured.  Apparently I am both shameless and gluttonous.

Honestly, it's probably for the best that I don't live in the vicinity (so if you see me here prowling the aisles and sheepishly loading baked goods into my cart, please send me packing back to my own 'hood...)  But now that I know of its existence, I'm already plotting excuses to drive by and get another fix.
author: Becca V.

description:
Who would have ever thought, walking back from the DMV, I would find such a gem of a place as this?

The bakery is to die for, and not only that - their bakery staff is top notched. They're not invasive constantly asking if you need help with anything, they offer suggestions instead and by suggestion - I mean they almost let you taste everything. Other than the cupcakes - which are little crack cakes, I never thought to find good red velvet cake past the Mason Dixon, but oooh my goodness - Delessio's is Yum. But I digress, I was torn between a few selections and this one woman (who was on her break too) suggested using the little cups and spoons to sample what I like. When I couldn't sample the cakes, she did the next best thing, she went into the open kitchen and pulled out the icing and filling for me to try. Seriously they're malt buttercream filling? Is that not the best?
