The cakes are moist, I came home with two cupcakes, some bread pudding and a chocolate cake with malt buttercream - all my friends raved about how the cake was sweet but not over sugary sweet and the consistency wasn't dry left out after a day.

Brownie points for the fair prices, and uber brownie points for their customer service. Coming into a higher end market and bakery - you expect high prices but usually it should come with the service and knowledge too. Delessio's delivers all that and 10 lbs you will never regret.
author: Jacquelyne L.

description:
My $.02 on some of Delessio's offerings:

OUT OF THIS WORLD

- Parking!!! 
- Cuban Pork Panini:  quite possibly my favorite sandwich ever.    
- Little Cupcakes:  I didn't get the big deal about cupcakes until I tried these.  Peanut butter mouse chocolate brownie is the best of the best.
- Make a meal out of the above two and it may be the most decadent $10 you ever spend.

EXCELLENT

- Hot food items, especially the mac n' cheese and brisket.
- Service is helpful and friendly

MERELY GOOD

- Value of the "meal deal" ($8.25/lb):  Whole Foods gives so much more food at the same price for their meal deal, with comparable quality.
- Pre-made sandwiches: interesting combinations, but bread can get soggy.    
- Tres Leches Cake:  doesn't hold a candle to Espetus' version of this cake.
author: Leon R.

description:
Best way to end a jog through Golden Gate Park and the Panhandle?

Stop by Delessio on the way home and sample enough spreads and crackers to render the jog worthless.
author: Alyssa R.

description:
Delessio Market and Bakery makes my sweet tooth so happy. MY favorite thing there is the butterscotch pudding.  *THUD* I died.  That's how good it is.  I kid you not.  They also have a butterscotch bar that's made from something like sweet potatoes, I believe?  It's been a while.  It's heavenly.  Tastes 85% like butterscotch and 15% sweet potato.  And you feel slightly less guilty about eating it.  At least I did.  The hot food deli there is also very, very good.  I am the lady that takes all of the garlic roasted potatoes.  It's me.  I sit there and wait forever for them to be done, and then I take most of them.  Probably not very polite.  

I like the mini-cupcakes, yes, but sometimes they can be a tad dry.  And something so teeny shouldn't be so busy.  You know. They'll have a banana caramel white chocolate mini cupcake with sea salt on top (I made that up, but you get the idea) and it's simply too much for a teeny cake. If they just graduated to full-size, they'd be stupendous.  The staff in the hot food area are supremely cool, and friendlier than the staff in the baked goods area.  Maybe the bakers are just shy?
author: suzana h.

description: Hello - this place frikkin rocks. It's like this non-touristy Dean and Delucas with tres leches for tasting. Good samples earn you an extra star. Period. I love it.
author: Andrew K.

description:
Like a little mini-Whole Foods right in the hood! Super friendly staff ready to help with a cheese question or a taste of the soup. The salad bar and soup are well-labeled (vegan, dairy, wheat, etc.) and the prepared hot food section is fresh and extra homemade-like. Try the jerk chicken!! 

And dessert--I wouldn't buy this fancy stuff for myself, but this bakery is a must-stop for parties. The mini-cupcakes are a gigantic hit with hosts/hostesses!
author: Gretchen T.

description: great foods, but super expensive. $3 for 1 scoop of ice cream!!!!! yikes. overall though, nice place. very clean. nice people.
author: Cecily B.

description:
Their food is: UNHEALTHY - IT WILL MAKE YOU FAT AND SICK .
We used to really love Delessio's food and we were very frequent consumers (even although they are very expensive). As you can see I used the word: were. After we purchased a very greasy and rather tasteless Thanksgiving dinner from them, I though I would try something again today - well, what a disappointment!, once again it was greasy, even the salads were greasy (and ridiculously expensive).
I will never again buy their food - I will shop at Whole Foods for prepared food from now on because I know their food is delicious and not greasy as well as being wholesome, organic and cheaper.
I strongly urge Delessio to change cooks and to prepare grease-less and tasty food - not food dripping in grease.
After eating their food today, I had an almost immediate case of heartburn.
author: Flower P.

description:
3 1/2 stars.

I think it's nice to have this little market in the neighborhood now...there seems to be nothing but the DMV and GG Park on Oak Street after you pass Divisadero.  Despite the premium pricing, Delessio's always seems to have well selected grocery items and fresh produce.  Their packaged granola section is impressive and they have pre-made Indian food by Sukkhi's that rivals some dishes I've tried at Indian restaurants in the Lower Haight.

The section of the store with take home meals, where you're charged by the pound, is nice but can get a bit expensive...especially with items like the rotiserrie chicken and meatloaf.  Yummy, but not heart-healthy, things you should try:  the meatloaf (the sauce is fantastic), macaroni, and potatoes au gratin.  The salad bar always looks good, but the meats and starches end up in my basket every time.  

I've ordered a lemon meringue tart and chocolate cake from the dessert bar, and although the desserts are very rich and decadent, they're not as fresh as they could be....which is disappointing ..especially with a $22 price tag for a cake!
author: LaSha G.

description:
If I have to pay $3.86 for a gallon of gas, I certainly won't mind paying for the $2.75 Almond crossiant, the best I've had in the city so far....and the chocolate ones looks very promising too. 
This has become one of my favorite breakfast spot especially with Peet's right next door. What more could you ask for?
author: L K.

description:
Good service can either make or break a positive Yelp review and I have to say, both the guys manning the sandwich counter and register at Delessio were top-notch, super friendly and helpful. After much deliberation, I chose to have the Cuban pork panini and my boyfriend had a fish po-boy. Along with a tiny container of the so-called best mac and cheese in SF and four mini cupcakes, we happily tucked into our feast at one of the tables outside. 

Those sandwiches are mightier than they appear! My panini was perfectly crisp on the outside and stuffed with juicy pork and pickles. My boyfriend liked his po-boy but could only finish half of it. He thoroughly enjoyed the mac and cheese and I'm sure we'll be back to try the other hot foods offered. We ended up eating the cupcakes later in the afternoon at the zoo. Oh boy! I think the miniature size is perfect and allows you to try more flavors at a time. My favorite was the lemon cake with lemon curd filling and raspberry frosting and coconut shreds. My boyfriend thought they were pretty dry and so his favorite cupcake is still the old fashioned from Miette. I think the texture of Delessio cupcakes remind me more of a muffin and that might explain the dryness. 

Regardless, we'll be back for lunch again. I'm looking forward to the cauliflower salad and tres leches cake!
author: Nathalie L.

description:
If I thought the grocery store was awesome, this is heaven. Hands down best sandwiches, cheeses, cured meats and a dreamy dessert station.  I was going to take a star off for being expensive, but the staff makes up for it. I dont go anywhere else when I am in the mood to shop for and TASTE excellent cheeses and procuitto, and LARDO (my latest delight). The staff is very knowledgeable about the cheeses and help you pick what you are looking for. They give you as many sample tastes and even recommend wines to pair it with.  The chocolate cookies are the best i've ever had, along with the mexican wedding cookies and mini cupcakes. 

Tito prepares sandwiches and is such a pleasure to talk to! He called it right away when I ordered my sandwich "are you cubana"?  and I said yupppp. he said, from mi-a-mi??? and i said, damn straight! LOL! we laughed and talked for 15 min b/c he's from puerto rico. Super nice guy and so nice to meet someone as nice and welcoming and heart warming as my cubans from miami. love it here.
author: Veronica P.

description:
One of my girlfriends brought me here...little did she know what would ensue.

We walked in the bakery side and I tried really, really hard to keep cool.  But I was overwhelmed with the petit fours just coyly staring at me, practically daring me to take a little nibble.  

Courtney: "pretty nice, right?" 

Me: walking around to the other side of the display, "um."  starting to sweat, "gulp."

Courtney: "Justine, what do you think?"

Me: "I think I want to fuck that bundt cake."

Courtney and the sales girl who heard it all: "PAWWWWWWWWW!"

I don't think I can go back to Delessio.  I'm really afraid of what I might do, and I bet they already have a code among the ranks to keep me out--"Code red, code red, the bundt fucker is back!  Gird your loins!!"
author: Justine H.

description:
I just spent $20 there today for lunch. I got:

roasted chicken

califlower with some kind of cream sauce

fennel something or another (delicious)

mac & cheese.

All from their buffet thingy. Everything was very good. I had never had fennel before and it was, delicious! My suggestion is to grab a little box, otherwise you'll have lotsa leftovers. 

I've been to this place many times since it opened on Broderick and I love it. It is a little pricy. 

The staff is super nice. The manager chef lady is helpful and friendly. 

Their cupcake bar is fantastic. So is their olive bar. But their cupcake bar, with all their little cupcakes, makes me feel like I am in cupcake heaven.
author: Mitsi M.

description:
I am an orgasmic post-Delessio haze, and I am Southern, and I have unabashedly and unapologetically been eating fat for the majority of my 25 years.

This shit is good.  Oooooze.
author: Coco K.

description:
While my car was getting washed, I strolled around the area in search for my morning latte. I stumbled upon Delessio Market and I smiled with delight! I've been wanting to check out this market and bakery for a while! What perfect timing!

I went straight to the bakery section. Everything looked heavenly. I was torn between the brioche breads and the muffins. I finally decided on the blueberry muffin. The muffin top was crispy and crunchy and the bottom of soft, moist and filled with large sweet blueberries. It went perfect with my latte. (There's a Peet's in the market) There's also a huge selection of mini cupcakes. I couldn't help myself, and also got a mini peanut butter cupcake topped with peanut butter mousse and merigue. It's SO cute. I wanted to buy more, but I controlled myself.

I walked around the market and checked everything out. It's very similar to Whole Foods. They also have a deli and hot food station too.
author: Denise L.

description:
I have never been here I have only read about it on Yelp.  

Somehow though a strawberry rhubarb pie made it's way to my house via a friend, my dear friend Leon.  Although I don't know what a rhubarb is I couldn't stop eating it.  I started off with one slice, then it went to two, and then three.  Then there was no more left as my family had eaten and finished the rest.  

To be honest I don't normally like any fruit pie other than apple pie.  So this was an amazing surprise.  A yummy one.  

Now I have to go back and try out the other things here so I can update my Yelp reviews.  I gotta  try the cupcakes, and the pork panini...........per Leon's review.
author: Denise B.

description:
Great location! It's in a quiet neighborhood inside of the supermarket Fratelli. It's a great spot to hang out on weekend mornings if you don't feel like standing in line for brunch. You get peet's coffee here, Delessio bakery and deli, and then some grocery shopping done. 

Best cupcakes!! I'd never imagine that there's a wonderland in a tiny cupcake!! I've tried almost every flavors and I loved all of them. I used to think cupcakes are just the most disgusting things in the world besides the sponge cake with sugary icing from my college cafeteria. Even when I went to high end bakeries, I never got it just because the size is too big to have a try. But these little cuties are just the right size. It is a heavenly sin, but it's small enough that it doesn't take long to persuade yourself that it's OK to indulge. The bread pudding was very good too, very similar to the bread pudding from Tartine. Once I went there and got inspired by the eggnog bread pudding so I went home and made my own. Delish...
author: Yuchi C.

description: The Huz and I are huge fans of this little complex. Nopalito, Peets and Falletti Bros are the best! Until tonight, I felt the same way about Delessio. Huz loves the cookies and cakes and sandwiches and I almost always bought desserts here to take to parties and potlucks. No more. I went in and grabbed a pre-made sandwich and pre-packaged cookies, so I didn't tip. Long haired brunette at Delessio cash register made a face, which I noted but without giving it much thought. I shopped around Falletti's for a bit, checked out and went to my car, where I realized I didn't have my keys. After checking with extremely nice (as always) clerk at Falletti's with no luck, I went back to Delessio and asked the same Delessio clerk who had waited on me whether I had left my keys. Without making eye contact, she pulled them out of a drawer and held them up for me to take. So... she made no effort to find me to return my keys or to be pleasant when I returned to claim them. Really? Because I didn't tip for pre-packaged foods? Too bad that Delessio lost a loyal customer over that, but that's how it goes when the bad taste from poor customer service overwhelms the great tasting food.
author: Cydney B.

description:
this is a semi upscale market and bakery inside of Falettis. 
it can get expensive, but the steam table food is usually fresh and scrumptious. lots of healthyness in their selection of foods.
it ranges from rottissire chicken, salads, ethnic sorts of rice, deli sandwiches, cupcakes, cakes...you name it.
it's a good neighborhood joint, and i highly recommend it for cakes and a quick healthy bite to eat. 
just be sure to bring at least $10-20 if you get anything!
author: trace c.

description:
did you say DELICIOUS?  OH, you said DELISSIO'S.  same thing.  i could barely stand it when i found out they were opening up a second location a mere 2 blocks from my house.  

now usually i try to eat healthy, don't eat a lot of sugar, but i tasted their mini-cupcakes (the chocolate brownie cupcake with cappucino buttercream and cinnamon meringue is a little piece of heaven), i was hooked.  then i sampled their "salad bar" and warm eats (they even have mac'n'cheese).  now, they're not cheap, but it's so f*in yummy, and b/c it's not cheap, i just eat a little bit so it's ultimately helping my waistline (at least that's what i keep telling myself).  

and there's a Faletti's Market and a Peet's (yah!  no goddamn starbucks!) right next door!   nice.
author: Suzanne A.

description:
Really? All the sandwhiches are premade, and even if you run out you won't make a sandwhich.  The panni's last but no matter how good your ingredients are cold sandwhiches go soggy pretty fast.  To put it nicely the people behind the deli also need to be um trained.  Or smarter.

Also, I realized the mac and cheese is more oily than creamy.  Which was the reason I was so excited about this place opening.

So really the only thing that is going to stand the test of time here is their selection of deli meats (make your own sandwhich) and the desserts.
author: b s.

description: This Delessio serves Humphry Slocombe Ice Cream now.  Woooohooooo.
author: Wakako U.

description:
The baddest Eggplant Parmigiana sandwich known to man. A huge lunch selection, including Mac n Cheese and a super friendly staff.

What's not to love? Do lunch.
author: Tushar V.

description: I wish they had a place like this anywhere in the South Bay - there are so many goodies here I always end up spending 15 minutes ogling everything before I make my final selection. I always grab a rare roast beef sandwich and then select a few other goodies to enjoy. They have a great salad/warm foods bar that is similar but better than the one you find at whole foods. Yum!
author: Viet T.

description:
4 stars for the stellar bakery.  And the bubble wrap chocolate.  Delessio is doing its job keeping me fat.  I can cardio 45 minutes a day till the day I die and undo it all with one trip here.

The staff has been nice.  I've only gotten the mac n' cheese from the hot section because the word BECHAMEL sauce loomed in its description and if I am anything, I am a milk/butter/flour whore.

It was ok, but nothing to write home about.

What I will write home about?  The uber-rich Tres Leches, the scandalous Croissant Bread Pudding and the mini cupcakes that keep me gyming it for fear I may have to wear stretchy pants for the rest of my life.
author: Jen I.

description: The mini cupcakes at this place are stellar and ornate, delicious AND healthy!! (or as healthy as they can be)... please eat!! :)
author: Steph M.

description:
The cupcakes are divine; fresh, flavorful and the perfect little bite for a sweet tooth. I also had some food from the hot bar.  While it was a little pricey & heavy (on the greasy side) it was indeed tasty.  On another occasion I had a breakfast pastry and it was great.   

So I went back to order a cake for a very special party.  We ordered the same type of cake that we had previously ordered from their Market street location; the first time around the cake made my guests practically have chocolate-gasms from the fabulousness of it.  But this time around I was so disappointed with the cake.  Granted it was pretty, but it tasted absolutely TERRIBLE because it was so hard and dry.  I was so let down, it was a cake for a very special party and instead of being  a high point it was quite frankly embarrassing.  Never have I had a cake made to order that tasted stale like this.  A couple of my guests took me to the side and told me I had better call the bakery and tell them about the cake. Talk about embarrassing. 

I called and spoke to the manager who originally offered me store credit.  I insisted on getting my money back and he agreed.   

Again, such a disappointment given previous experiences.  Also a disappointed given the prices, they are not cheap.
author: Ronnie T.

description:
The other day I was making some Kraft mac 'n cheese for the exchange student living with me and I felt bad. I tried to dress it up with a can of tuna and some pepper but I still felt guilty. I felt worse when I went to Delessio's by myself and had a half pound of their mac 'n cheese and a half roasted chicken and a Stone IPA. I was having a great lunch and rubbing my belly while Sato was probably rubbing his head.

Anyway, he's not reviewing me, I'm reviewing Delessio's. They have a wonderful assortment of hot dishes, panini's, cold salads, and sweets. You can buy your lunch and a beer from Falletti's and sit in the market and watch the cars go by. It is as expensive as a restaurant though but you don't have to tip anyone.
author: Hunter G.

description:
I've temporarily transplanted into the neighborhood, so last Thursday I decided to go to this place because of the Peet's that's attached.  From Peet's, I wandered into Faletti Fine Foods to buy some necessities (yogurt, Puffins cereal, frozen peas) and went on my merry way home.  I never noticed Delessio Bakery in back until...

Fast forward three days to Sunday, when breakfast had come and gone, and my boyfriend and I decided we needed coffee and a walk.  To Peet's we go, borrowed dog in tow.  I showed him Faletti, which he'd never been inside, but this time we walked all the way to the back and... WHAM!  Delessio.

I was hit by a thunderbolt or something as I looked upon this counter bathed in heavenly golden light.  There were angels and harps and... chocolate and cakes by the dozen!  Fudge and cupcakes and tarts and cookies and crisps and strudels and bread pudding - oh sorry, I mean CROISSANT pudding.  Everything good, rich, and delicious sitting there just LOOKING at me.  I realized I'd been holding my breath and let out a sigh.  It was like this brunch that I felt like I'd never been invited to.  Until now!  Grabbed one - er, two - of those little cardboard containers and filled those suckers to the brim with cupcakes and amaretti and peach crisp.  

Went back to try the chocolate chip cookie today.  Pretty sure I'll find some excuse to go have the Tres Leches cake tomorrow.  Glad I'm moving back to my own 'hood next week or else I'd probably have to start buying pants with the spandex waist.
author: Marina Maven C.

description:
I don't spend much time in this area.  My Dad took me here after a work thing nearby, and effective food mind control made us give up 60 bucks within seven minutes.

It's a market and bakery - they've got two in SF.  Of course they do catering.  If you like the grub at Whole Foods you'll like this place better.

I can't remember what my Dad got, but I picked up the baby back ribs (Memphis style w/house-made BBQ sauce), mac & cheese, and rare roast beef sandwiches (cotswald cheese, grilled onions, lettuce, tomato & horseradish aioli on a Kaiser roll).  Wifey and I finished all of this in one night.  The ribs in particular were great because they were juicy, tender and melted at the touch of a knife.  BBQ sauce was neither too watery / salty.

I didn't get a chance to try their desserts.  Jealously walked by a couple of the sweeties.  I almost knocked over a stand because my mouth was watering over a cheesecake (after spending the $60).  On par with walking down the street and seeing Jessica Alba.  Although food is higher up on Maslow's hierarchy of needs...

I have to go back!  Pretty close to the DMV so after you have wasted half your day there you deserve a treat here.  Spending time at the DMV is like going to a funeral.  If not for iPods, the only form of entertainment is trying to guess which folks are probably getting fake IDs.  The funniest thing I saw was a  T-shirt which read, "University of Chicago - where fun comes to die."  It's a good school but that's pretty f-ing funny.  My buddy told me that they also have one that says, "University of Chicago - where the only thing that goes down on you is your grades."

Delessio rocks!
author: Jimmy F.

description:
AHHHHHHH! OMG! I am so in heaven.

mini cupcakes--bought 3, and tried to save them for tomorrow. FAILED.

so goooood!
author: Sassy O.

description:
When I first found Delessio on Market after a visit to Flax, I thought I had found a new favorite! But it was so out of my neighborhood. I simply relished my lunches after buying art supplies and it became a little treat.

Someone must have listening, because their second location is a mere 3 minute walk from my front door!! I don't love to cook, so having such wonderfully prepared food at my fingertips is delightful. Whether it's the self serve "sugar shock" (homemade desserts) bar, the rotisserie chicken or the other warm edibles, it hits the spot.

Check out their cakes and other catering possibilities. It certainly doesn't fall into the "inexpensive" category, but perhaps that can be overlooked with the first bite of bread pudding!
author: A E.

description:
I enjoyed several bites of many different pastries from here at a post-wedding brunch.  Yum!  The ham and cheese croissant (very light on the ham) is very tasty and great after spending 6 hours at a wedding reception the night before.  Just the right amount of "grease" - without being junky food.

I stop by here every other week on my way home from work, on those nights when I don't want to cook dinner.  Good variety of pre-made/cooked items, in a serve-yourself buffet.

I would say to stop in just for the chocolate bubble wrap.  A unique chocolate bar experience.
author: darla s.

description:
Two dollars for a mini-cupcake seems a bit steep, until the first bite.  The flavors rotate seasonally and the available selection varies from day to day, but most are extremely delicious.  The standout flavors include their mint-chocolate (rich flourless chocolate cake base with peppermint buttercream frosting dipped in chocolate ganache), and the ginger-cranberry (gingerbread base with cranberry preserves/jam topped with orange buttercream).  If you see either of these, GET THEM.  The peanut butter and jelly flavor looks enticing, and I find that they generally do a good job with flavors incorporating jams/preserves, I just haven't tried it since I hate peanuts.  Occasionally a flavor is a bit unremarkable, for example, I would like to recommended the pancake cupcake, but alas I can't; the maple buttercream with bacon bits on top is tasty, but the cupcake base is bland and dry. The smore flavor was visually pleasing but similarly underwhelming in flavor; the chocolate piece decorating the frosting is too thick to bite into with the cupcake, and the flavor lacks overall depth. Generally speaking try one (or two) of their cupcakes (with the exception of the smore and pancake flavors) on offer and you won't be disappointed.

The bubble-wrap chocolate is also worth trying, it's essentially a chocolate bark, made with exceptional chocolate (Valhrona I believe, or maybe it was Callebaut) molded on a piece of bubble wrap (or more likely a mold shaped like bubble wrap) and then topped with novel flavors.  My favorites are the milk chocolate with cinnamon sugar and slivered almonds, and the dark chocolate with malt powder.   Again, it's no surprise that these run on the pricey side, but I find that they are more than worth it.  They seem to no longer offer these in a make your own assortment fashion, you have to buy the pre-packaged bag which has a variety of flavors including white-chocolate (ew), but I still think they'd make a well-received gift. 

The selection of cheeses and charcuterie/deli meats isn't as extensive as whole foods, but is well curated, and in my experience the staff is happy to give out recommendations/samples.  

The salad/prepared food bar is a step up from most of the offerings at whole foods, although its similarly overpriced for what you're getting.  Nonetheless I like to get a few to-go boxes from time to time with a variety of pastas/salad/etc for an impromptu picnic in nearby Buena Vista Park.

Also note that they have a small selection of Humphry Slocombe ice cream, which is nice if you want to avoid the crowds at the flagship store in the mission. 

Bottom line: this can be a five-star place if you order correctly, but I've had a few too many dissapointments lately (pancake and smore cupcakes I'm looking at you) and am downgrading to four stars.  Get a chocolate peppermint or cranberry ginger cupcake if they have them!
author: Nicole P.

description: Yum. That's about all I can say. I've enjoyed every one of their baked goods that I've trid.
author: Amelia D.

description:
Fabulous deli... so glad they're in my 'hood!

Most often than not, we often use the Delessio hot food section to round out a meal of leftovers - their roasted broccoli with caesar dressing, mac and cheese, and black bean green beans are always delicious.

For entrees we love their pork shoulder cooked any way - sometimes we see it beer-braised; other times cooked with coconut milk, lemongrass and chiles - always exceptional.

They have a more extensive fancy cheese counter than Falletti's, though I wish they'd carry more Northern California cheeses such as Cowgirl and Point Reyes.  They've also recently hired a staffmember who's very knowledgeable about cheeses.

And the list goes on -- nothing on the hot table strikes your fancy? Turn around and peruse the cold case where offerings also change daily -- at any one time you're likely to see bread puddings, crab cakes, country pates, and individual lasagna servings, along with deli meats.

The salad bar rarely changes - you'll most likely find roasted veggies, romaine lettuce, edamame, noodle salad, beet salad, bulgur and couscous, dressed cucumbers, olives and cold thai chicken every day.

The desserts are sometimes hit-or-miss (hits: eggnog bread pudding; miss: dulce de leche cake) but you can never go wrong with the mini cupcakes.

Outdoor seating for those who have puppies or like the cold.
author: Claudine C.

description:
I have two words for you: Mini Cupcakes.

I'm very happy this place isn't close to me. It is walking distance, but not "run out and grab 15 cupcakes to stuff in my face and be back in my house in 10 minutes" walking distance. This distance may keep me from gaining a zillion pounds from eating all the yummy stuff here. 

Oh - they also have hot food, salads, an olive bar and deli. And cakes. Yummy, beautiful cakes. And did I mention the mini-cupcakes?
author: Sarcastic T.

description:
What to choose! What to choose!!!??????????

Delessio was recommended by a trusted coworker who shares the same food standards. I typically shy away from buffet style looking set ups, but not this one. 

The market is comparible to a petite Adronicos/ Cossentino's/Lunardi's.  Great service the moment you walk in.  They were very helpufl and made sure you understood how the set up worked for first timers like me today.  

so much to choose from.  The Mac and Cheese, Polenta Gratin, and Baked potatoes truly represented homestyle authentic cooking. I then headed over to the fresh salad bar and indulged in the Greek Salad.  

I didn't get a chance to dive into the pastries as I didn't want to take the spotlight away from the homestyle food.... I'm excited for the next journey and this time I will make sure to make room for the delicate pastries... yummmmmm!!!
author: Genevieve J.

description:
I am so happy this place is now in m hood. I can be so tired and run in for 5 minutes and grab a yummy whole roast free range chicken, some gormet mac and cheese, and a little arugala salad and have an amazing dinner for 2 for pretty cheap. the customer service makes all the difference as well. as fancy as it is the people working there are always friendly and seem to like what they sell. no attitude. being a small business owner I really react well to friendly service.
AMAZING selection of cheeses, cookies, and chocolate. perfect for picnic day in the park. yum yum
author: Jayne M.

description:
Hot Food: 5 stars
Desserts: 5 stars
Service: 5 stars
Manager: 5 stars

It's probably good that Delessio doesn't offer Directo Deposito right from my paycheck, because I swear, that's where my money in the 2 to 3 weeks since its opening. I've pulled back since then, having learned that "moderation is the mother of being able to go the movies".

There's nothing I can add about the place except what you should order:

1) Barbec--sorry--Sloooow Barbecued Beef Brisket. Melt in yo' damn mouth.
2) Mac and Cheese. Cheesy, oily, lovely. Calling this Mac and Cheese is like calling a diamond a shiny rock.
3) Chicken Vindaloo. Quite Vindaloo-ey. Whatever that means, it's delicious!
4) Green Curry Tofu. This creature only comes out as much as old Haley's ice-and-rock, but when it's out, you could swear it was Christmas. Soft tofu cubes (blobs, if you come late), curry, and coconut milk, all infused with the soul of lemongrass.
5) Brazilian (French) Toast. Go to the bakery. Find this. Eat it. (Don't forget to pay for it before you walk out of the store.) Covered in  cinnamon sugar and goodness, I could eat three of these with a latte from Oakside Cafe.

As an aside, all the employees here are gracious, knowledgeable and in love with their job. The manager is a neighborhood gem.
author: Rey T.

description:
I work next to DeLessio/Falletti and can say it has been a love/hate relationship from the get...

I LOVE DeLessio's baked goods. There are essays to be written about how f'n delicious and creative it all is, and lucky for you all the other reviewers have written to such lengths so I don't have to. There is a special place in my heart for a bakery section of this caliber.

I HATE how expensive the salad bar is. Every time I tell myself, "I am never buying anything from this salad bar again". It is like SURPRISE!! Your tiny amount of food comes to $10! Why? They say they dont charge for the boxes, but why then is it this expensive?! I guess it is because of how delicious their snooty deli food is, but it's really not THAT great. Really. It's not.

I HATE and LOVE how I cannot  count on my favorites being there when I come in. They just have whatever they have everyday. I need some sort of schedule; something to count on. It seems that the days they have something I love, they have EVERYTHING I love. Likewise on other days, I cant seem to find a thing. Maybe they do this because they know, as stated above, that their food is so expensive that having all the favorites everyday would render me poor and unable to shop there at all.

I LOVE the Falletti Foods market. I am a vegetarian and that is part of the love and the extra star for this place. They are very well accommodating to me and my appetite, as they have a wide variety of vegetarian and organic foods alike. The market is expensive, but really  nothing more than Whole Foods, and this is a complaint that that has tried to be solved by Trader Joes. Who is doing a fine job I might add, but at a different level.

The place is great now and again for some treats. It is nothing to count on though. The quality and flavor ranges in the salads and hot foods. But the bakery and artisan cheeses really make up for anything else lacking.
author: Audrey K.

description:
I discovered this little place when my boyfriend & his friends were visiting a store around the neighborhood.  I walked in & instantly fell in love with everything - cheesecake, cookies, deli sandwiches, chocolate cake.

I always end up buying a big box of desserts and a sandwich.
author: Tisha Y.

description:
We were picnicking with good friends on a Napa hillside overlooking the valley when one of the group pulled out his contribution: Brown sugar cornbread from Delessio.

As we bit into its golden goodness, the sun's light seemed to dim for a minute. 

It's *that* good.

On a more recent foray I had their mind-blowing macaroni and cheese. Seriously, the walls started melting as I savored the deliciousness.
author: Sharand N.

description:
When I was going through a kitchen remodel in the summer of '07, Delessio kept me well fed and happy.  
Recently, they seem to have slipped down a slippery slope of just not giving a crap.  Last time I was in the salad bar looked like it had been attacked by a (gaggle, group, cluster?) of hungry bunnies.  The hot food section was depleted, while "workers' behind the counter were having a deep discussion on the meaning of life.  The "manager" was restocking an already full bakery display -- he would have been great on the Titanic polishing silverware as the ship sank.
Bakery items are very good.  The savories have the ability to be delicious, and for the gawdawful prices they charge, should very well be.  They do the annoying "service charge for health care" too.
I think we won't be patronizing any more.  No wonder Faletti's is opening a deli on premises.  They would do well to boot Delessio out of the space -- they can't live up to it.
author: Matthew G.

description: I come here when I want my Secret Breakfast sans lines. Enjoying Humphry Slocombe ice cream followed by chilling out in the Panhandle on a sunny day is a dreamy itinerary.
author: Winter R.

description:
Gotta love Delessio's Farmers Market buffet for $9.99 / lb:

lots of hot and cold menu items change on a daily basis, including yummy sliders, grilled meats and all the fresh veggies a good diet requires...

The salad bar has large wooden bowls and salad utensils, so you can dress & mix your salad right there. 
Everything looks fresh - and everything I tried within the last couple of days was TASTY!

Compostable utensils and cups help the environment - plus, the outside tables get sun from late morning to late afternoon.
author: Francis S.

description:
I have to say Delessio has never let me down.  I've used Delessio on Market Street and the one off the Panhandle for many catering events and office events...  the cakes are amazing, inexpensive and people are dazzled by the extravagant look.  They once wrapped a gift basket of food for 50 in celephane an even put on a bow!  Thier staff is wonderful.

If you are looking to order a lot of food, enough for 35 -100 people or more, you should allow a week to a couple of days for the staff to prepare, but the staff pulled off a last minut job for me in less then 3-4 hours.
author: patrick r.

description:
The chocolate chip cookies are soooooo good!  It's hard to resist eating an entire bag in a day.  

I agree, the tres leches cake used to be better a year ago and it's more creamy than light.  The cupcakes are also more dry than they used to be.  Still, the desserts are good overall and the staff is helpful.
author: T M.

description:
When this place opened two or three years ago, I would spend all I could here.  There was so much good stuff then.

Since then I've noticed some pretty sad things happening, here they are in order:
1.)  They cut back on their kitchen and cooks.  The cold sandwiches weren't made here anymore.  The cool looking lasagna disappeared.  Selection and freshness took a noticeable hit. 
2.) The staff started becoming much less enthused.
3.) They started completely running out of stuff by 7pm.  Right when I'm coming home late from dinner and starved.  This one cut me deep.
4.) Their selection of food is now rivaled by your typical corner coffee shop.  I went in yesterday, Sunday, at noon and there were zero cold sandwiches and nothing -NOTHING! - looked appetizing.  

I can't speak for the Market St. location, where things are actually made, but the wheels are slowly falling off at Broderick.  They are showing all the signs of closing sometime in 2009.
author: Ben M.

description:
CUBAN PORK SAMMICH. 

I crave them. I crave them so much I wake up in the middle of the night with pangs in my stomach. 

Great for their cheese and salami too- I always stop in when hosting an event to get appetizers and desserts. Amazing tiny little cupcakes!
author: teriaki b.

description:
I can't remember the last time I saw a brioche in San Francisco before this place opened up.

And this was a transcendent brioche, fresh organic berries baked into a light pastry with a touch of marzipan and sugared icing.  Perfection.

The sandwiches are on such thick bread that they have to be on the grill for quite awhile to be warm on the inside, so don't do that when you're in a rush as I was.  Still tasty tho.  And spendy, real spendy, but quality comes at a price, no?

Take care to look up and notice the not-so-clear lines between the Delessio Bakery and the Falletti Foods Market that it's joined to.  No, you can't buy your Delessio sandwich at Falletti (or vice versa), but at least they're nice about it when they send you back to the other end of the store.
author: Jennifer S.

description:
One day, I was really really hungover, and probably still a little bit drunk. I needed food, and since I was still wearing my fancy-pants party dress and makeup from the night before, I decided I wanted fancy-pants food to match.

This place did the trick. Awesome.
author: Rhea B.

description:
5 stars for their chocolate chip cookies ALONE.  We swear they put crack in those things, they are so good.   We buy about 2 bags a week, which is like nearly a $50/month cookie habit!  

We've even been baking cookies at home, desperately trying to see if we can replicate the magic recipe.  No such luck.

So - beware!!!  Don't eat the chocolate chip cookies!!!  You'll belong to Delessio's for life.

(Minus one star for cramped space and wonky layout.)
author: Wes P.

description: This is where I go to get my cheese! They have my favorite cheese from Gary Danko--Midnight moon! Every time I bring this cheese to a dinner, everyone loves it!
author: Kim D.

description:
Nice presentation

food is sold by the pound - and is tasty - too heavy though - everything seems to be made with cream AND cheese - 

Was drooling over the potatoes Au gratin the other day - Renee - (works preparing the food) - ran and got me a sample - sigh - so nice - what a pleasure - then I bought some and ate it - DAMN her - (Sigh - I had to buy more - it was so good - she is such a treasure - pleasure to eat her food)

then of course those damn cookies were calling my name .......
author: Marc G.

description:
Really good food, but REALLY over priced (I agree with other posters).

  Since they jacked up the prices on the Hot food bar, I have not been back.  Someone mentioned that they were talking about having a special for those of us that are not rich, good idea.  I have an even better one, why not have half price on all the ready food (that normally gets thrown away) at the last 45 minutes of each day of business?  I would go often if they did!   Just my two cents............
author: John C.

description:
I hate to do it, cause I think everyone that works here is great...but I can only give this place 3 stars due to how pricey it is.  If you have money, please go here and gorge yourself on their amazing selection of cheeses, meats, pastries, and wonderful cakes and such.  However, if you live off of a grad student's budget, be very careful before coming in here.  Some of the smaller, individually priced items are great (croissants, bread pudding, etc.) but the food by the pound is out of control.  And you pay the same amount for a pound of mac and cheese as you do for a piece of roasted chicken.  

Plus side, the staff are super helpful and nice to talk to.
author: Katie O.

description:
Perfect little cupcakes.  Pastries equal to Tartine without the lines or the attitude.  The towering lemon decadence cake...sweeeeet!
Reasonable prices for high quality.
author: Rob B.

description:
The food here kicks a#s!!! If you're a sweet freak, you've gotta go!

They've also got good hot prepared foods and the cheese selection is usually better than average. At least you're not spending your Whole Paycheck...if you know what I mean.
author: Scott N.

description: Wow.  When you go here you must try their Rabanada.  I went there on a typical cloudy morning with my boyfriend and we ordered some bite sized cupcakes and then this rabanada.  It's a brasilian french toast that is covered in sugar and cinnamon. But the best part is once you bite into the crispy exterior you're mouth is given a special gift of soft, moist bread.  It was so good we debated going back for seconds when we were already at Fishermen's Wharf.  San Diego definitely needs one of these bakeries or at least a bakery that can make this d*lish treat!
author: Maegan S.

description:
The food here is sooooooooooooooooo good.  One of the best cold bars I've ever seen so it's great for a quick lunch if you live/work in the area.  They have a wide variety of flavorful dishes and many vegan/vegetarian options.

I have one serious gripe, however.  They have compostable utensils accompanied by a sign that boasts "new compostable forks made from potatoes!"  but NO COMPOST BIN.   I said something about this almost a year ago and the guy working assured me they would be getting one soon.  How soon?  2012? I said something again yesterday and the guy yelled at me and said "throw it away it doesnt matter!"  Places that do this (Whole Foods is another) just make 'going green' a fashion trend.  Maybe if enough people  say something they will make the 5 minute call to the city and order a green bin.
author: Rachel D.

description: Delicious ready to eat meals in the healthy hot food section.  Their housemade Bubble Wrap Chocolate will bring you back for more.
author: michael p.

description:
Hands-down the most impressive hot chocolate I've had in my life. They have a mocha version too. 
Their cakes are stunning and delicous also.
author: Melanie G.

description: Delessio's, thank you for lowering your price to $9.99/lb. We can be friends again. However, you only get 4 stars because the selection has become a little slim. Mac & cheese...it's still good!
author: Kandace K.

description:
I enjoy the food at both Delessio locations in San Francisco. I usually enjoy the food and like the preparations, but find them to be inconsistent. Sometimes it is great, and sometimes less than average. Service is much the same, helpful but with attitude. 

The bakery department always looks better than it tastes. Wish it tasted as good as it looks.
author: Foodie F.

description:
after 2 days of fun-filled off-roading in sizzling hot hollister hills, we drove to the city to have our early dinner & to cool-off specifically at this place.

amazingly expensive foods of pleasant & well-prepared hot dishes of comfort fares, as well as their huge, crunchy, fresh panini breads/sandwiches.
the roasted turkey with cheese & cranberry aoili sauce and reuben panini was delectable!

the mac and cheese was baked in perfection, which we got it as our side! an eight pieces of their super-mini cupcakes in different flavors was what we had for dessert....and it was awfully pricey!

we took a seat in their red tables & chairs and devour hungrily the food. it was worth it!

we took a tour of the whole place and i would say it is a scaled-down "whole foods market".
author: Nelle A.

description:
i was dreaming of nutrition
and my heart was beating slow...

then i entered the salad section of Delessio Market while waiting for my number at the DMV across the street. it was modest in selection, but every ingredient seemed nourishing. 

i scooped everything i could see into my bowl, making something that looks more like bibimbop without the rice. got a coke too and went to the register. $13 total.  Ok, that's a pretty expensive salad. it had better be good. 

i found salad leaves too green to resist.
celery roots? didn't know they were edible, but they tasted good.
the olives were delicious, apparently all grown locally. 

if i'm supporting locally grown organic produce this delicious, i don't mind going broke.

i may update this review after going broke eating here.
author: Jae K.

description: Stopped into this place when walking just off of Haight, grabbed a delicious honey almond coffee cake. So good I didn't waste any time finishing this review until now, 3 months later.
author: Kyle S.

description: I had such a great experience there i had to make a note,,,the young man behind the counter Ernie was so very helpful, patient and nice i just had to give him some props.  Thank you for all you tips and a great lunch,,,i wll be back.
author: Nicole q.

description:
this place is where sandwiches reside when they die and go to heaven.  where mac and cheese sings.  backed up by an orchestral array of a deli counter: unique looking cheeses (with samples, definitely my style), salads of all varieties, meats, chocolate shavings, foods that sound as if they are from other places of the world, lots of wine, and baked statues of art.  i've been dying to try one of their colossal cakes and today it dawned on me my brithday is coming up!  finally an excuse to buy a cake all for myself!  i will keep you posted.  until then go to their site, peruse their food pictures, and drool with me.

*2/4 edit - just found out they opened Nopalito in the same complex, of the people behind Nopa (haven't been, but want to try).  so, i can get quality, organic made from scratch mexican food AND a towering deck of cake IN ONE SITTING?  dangerous!
author: Dee C.

description:
The food is good. I would give it five stars if it looked better. Considering the fact that the few times I went there, it was after five could contribute to it's presentation - but seriously - it looked pretty unappetizing. The mashed potato's aren't very good, but whatever, who cares about the mashed potatoes? The meat is to die for. The meatloaf melts in your mouth with a sweet barbecue sauce, and the other beef is good. The tofu in green stuff is kinda nice...I made the mistake of overloading my plate with sauce (making the weight much heavier...) and the sauce by itself is disgusting. The cooked potatoes are really well seasoned - there's dairy or something in it...

They give samples for almost all the food...what more is there to say?
author: Shizuka L.

description: Dropped another star.  This is just about the worst time I can imagine to raise your prices 50%, but that's exactly what they've done... gone from $8.50/ pound to $12.50/ pound, resulting in a $20 salad the other day.  Even I can't justify that, and I justify plenty!  I know, I know, organic, sustainable, all lovely... but really, this just isn't the time for price increases, guys.
author: Jennifer P.

description: Holy Heifers. I was never so glad to blow $25 on a take out lunch with dessert in my life!
author: Jared K.

description: YUM!!! Such a great place to stop on the way home from work to grab tasty amazing food.   The variety and flavors are wonderful.   It is fabulous when you are exhausted and need a nourishing meal.
author: Megan j.

description:
Delessio's cakes are some of the worst I have ever eaten in my life. I eat cake from everywhere. You know what you are getting with a Safeway or Costco sheet cake. They are adequately priced and taste adequate. No surprise. A I Dream of Cake cake taste pretty good. But let's face it, no one really buys those cakes for the taste. They look amazing. And you get what you pay for. Schubert's cake is pretty damn good, not too pricey and delicious to boot. I could go on and on about satisfactory and awesome cakes. But I'm here to rant about Delessio. A cake from Delessio can ruin anyone's day. They look beautiful. That is why I have been suckered into buying a few of them. I pray before I have a piece of their cake that it will just be a good little piece of cake, at least as good as it looks. Most recently, I've had the chocolate ganache cake of extreme sadness and demon chocolate cake with vanilla crap frosting. I so love cake and want to love every cake. But every single Delessio cake has been an epic disappointment. You incur all of the calories of a giant piece of lard with the texture and satisfaction of eating a giant piece of lard. 

One star because I sometimes like their sammies. The sandwiches are sometimes a little dry or a little wet or both. But my standards for sandwiches are lower.
author: Jen O.

description: Food is just as good as the Market location, but with parking.  This location is connected to Faletti's Market, so you could do your grocery shopping and they take your hunger right through to Delessio.  Make sure to pay for you groceries before crossing over.  Selection of food is almost the same, some things here and some things at the other location.  Can't go wrong with their panini sandwiches and all their pastries as well as their bubble wrap chocolate.
author: Jason A.

description: A cute little deli and bakery tucked inside a larger grocery store filled with post-brunch gatherings of people tucked into books or drinking coffee.  They have a nice assortment of miniature cupcakes for inexpensive sampling - tried the boston cream and chocolate cake - the base was moist though the frosting tasted mostly of sugar.  Also sampled 7x7's acclaimed oatmeal raisin cookie, which had a nice crunch, but tasted a bit stale.
author: Jeremy C.

description: I LOVE this place. I stop here every time I am in the neighborhood, finding some reason that I should need a pastry or hot plate of mac-n-cheese or WHATEVER. Ok, I admit it is a bit pricey, but it is so freakin' yummy and always hits the spot. Not to mention the people who work there are extremely helpful and friendly. Their bakery kicks butt, you can't pass up the brazilian french toast thingy, I forget it's actual name, but it is a little slice of heaven. Then there is the hot bar, with amazing bbq'd pork, mac-n-cheese (did I mention that already?), scalloped potatoes, WICKED tofu, etc.etc. I drool at the fancy cakes in the case, wishing that my birthday were coming sooner so I'd have an excuse to order one of those bad boys! Go there, NOW!
author: Becky P.

description: Mini Cupcakes!  At a 1.75, they are cheaper substitute to Kara's  with almost the equivalent in flavors and decoration  (and the parking is way easier than the Marina).
author: K W.

description: I want to like this place more - it's a great concept and has a good vibe, but the food is average. Their cakes - Lemon Decadence and Chocolate Tower Cake - are gorgeous monstrosities. They are rich and not as sweet as other places (that's a good thing). However, I felt their other bakery items (mini cupcakes and others) were just average (dry, flavorless, overly sweet). For baked goods and other bakeries, I'm a fan of Nibs, Noe Valley Baking Company, Della Fattoria (Petaluma), Downtown Bakery and Creamery (Healdsburg), Virginia Bakery (Berkeley - try their triple chocolate cake YUM!), Arizmendi, ACME (Berkeley for their walnut raisin bread).
author: Cammy H.

description: Wow, the best cakes, pastries and danish around. I have not eaten the sandwiches and other hot food but it all looks scrumptious. A little pricy on the hot items but their danish (Plain Croissants $2) is completely reasonable. One of my guilty pleasures. The cakes on display look so good but you will use the better half of a Benjamin. Dont be confussed by the rip off gourmet market housed in the same building.
author: Mike K.

description: 3 stars now since they re-adjusted their prices. I'm still a little upset that they did that though, plus it remains on the pricey side for what you get.
author: Brian W.

description: This place has Excellent food and it's easy and quick to get. You just go in and there's a buffet type thing, so you just get a box and start putting things in it. It's all about 9 bucks a pound so it is fairly reasonably although if you are really hungry you could end up spending like 12 bucks for dinner. It's really convenient to be able to grab a bunch of excellent food real fast and take it home on your way in from work. They also have an excellent bakery in case you feel like getting fat or bringing some stuff to a party. Anyway they always change the stuff around but you can always get a good salad, amazing Polenta and Meatloaf, mac and cheese, and whatever they are currently cooking. They also have great paninis and ready made sandwiches.
author: Dave C.

description:
Oh My God. I stumbled in here after a hellish DMV experience, trying to change my registration so that I could get a new parking sticker so that I can park in my new neighborhood without getting (another) ticket....how I hate moving. It was pretty much the most stressful week of my life, and and soon as I stepped in here, I started drooling with excitment. Gorgeous open salad bar when you can just pick out everything you want and shove it in a white box. This is the kind of place I wish was around the corner from my apartment, I would be there constantly. I decided to stuff as much as I could in there and make it my next 2 or 3 meals.....pesto pasta. Thai chicken. Peanut noodles. Garlic broccoli. Rotisserie chicken leg. Roasted potatoes. Teriyaki green beans. Everything looked fucking amazing. Paying 22.00 wasn't the best, but like I said, I was planning to stretch this since there was no food my new fridge.

Of course, I ended up polishing all of it off over the course of that same day.
author: Jenna W.

description: what a find in NOPA...better location than on Market Street because it is nicer to pull into a parking spot to gorge...yes ...I did use that word..GORGE...on the things I love at Delessios!!! I think this branch just opened up Veteran's Day weekend 2006, but will be super crowded in time for Holiday hosting and visiting with yummy stuff I can get from Delessio's that I want to share with friends. Oh...what about the salads? Is it Falleti's influence that there are serious greens here or was it just a nice afterthought. Anyway, still am happy that Delessio has ventured beyond Market, above Market next to a nice beefyfish and poultry finding Market....Hooray...better than wholepaychex...LOCALLY owned y'all, not feeding Austintexanistas.
author: miriam b.

description: I love the Delessio on Market, but going there was always a pain because it was hard to find parking. Now that Delessio has opened up a second location just one block from mi casa, with a parking garage as well, it's both a blessing and curse. Blessing because I don't have to go far to have my favorite Delessio dishes (mmmm....mac and cheese and cauliflower salad!) or satisfy my sweet tooth (cupcakes galore!) or my antipasto yearnings (all the fixings for a good plate). A curse because it's not the kind of prices you'll find at the Safeway Deli. But I love it all the same. Thanks Delessio for moving into my neighborhood!
author: Suepattra M.

description: YUM!  I love Delessio's.  I always over eat because everything looks so good and I can't stop piling food on my plate.  It is a great place to go with a variety of taste buds because there is something for everyone.  The serve as an open buffet and then weigh your plate for the price.  So if you eat a little you pay a little, but I have yet to meet anyone who can stop adding food to their mound.  Their desserts are spectacular as well.  I highly recommend Delessio's for lunch!
author: Lolo S.

description: Great food and baked goods.  I've liked pretty much everything I've had here.  It's pricey, however, so I try not to indulge too often.  Had some mac and cheese last night.  Got it right at close so it had been out, but was still very good.  $20 bucks for a little less than a meal's worth each for 2 people.
author: Zach J.

description: The cheese guy was really helpful (and hilarious) the other day, assisting me in the selection of a fine assertive soft cheese that I have since been calling the "foot cheese." It smelled like dirty socks, tasted amazing, and was only $3.75 for a nice big wedge. This place is great!
author: Beth W.

description: The place is gorgeous. Everything looks amazing. I got a roast beef sandwich ($9) and a little curried turkey slider ($3.50). The boy got a chicken wrap and some beets in horseradish yogurt. The beets were awesome. Very good, but not really worth $10/lb. The roast beef sandwich had so much gristle that I almost threw up eating it. It was unchewable and the parts I did actually eat are probably going to sit in my stomach in an undigestable glob for the next week or two. The curried turkey salad tasted okay, but when safeway's turkey salad is better you know there's a problem. The boy ate half of his chicken wrap and thought something tasted off. He left the rest on top of a trash, and later wondered whether that wasn't a bad idea and he should have just thrown it away, because he was still sick this morning. Boo.
author: Monika M.

description: OK, you simply must try the ultra decadent Tres Leches dessert. It is sticky and messy, and so sweet it makes my teeth hurt, but I couldn't stop eating it
author: Brad C.

description: Fabulou$ Fabulou$ Fabulou$ - I could have used the money to pay the light bill and rent - but who cares about that when you can sit in the dark  on the sidewalk and eat the Dulche Leche cake (w/strawberries) with your bare hands?????
author: sHoo o.

description:
I love cheese and DeLessio's has an amazing selection.  If you don't know what you want, ask Sam, the manager of the cheese department.  She'll give you tastes, tell you what she eats, tell you what's in 'season' do special orders, cut any size piece you want and she is passionate about what she does.

She get's 5 stars for customer service!
author: k c.

description:
me:  "is your salad bar organic?"

cashier:  "uh.."

manager-looking-guy:  first he snickers and then:  "well what do you mean by 'organic'?"

me:  "um, just is it organic?"

manager-looking-guy:  "well, uh, technically no, but it is really fresh."

i really wanted to like this place, since i work in the area and spend more time than i'd like at the bank of america in the complex, but i'd rather go up the street to green chile kitchen and have an organic salad with roasted organic chicken from staff/owners that are pleasant, understand what organic means and they aren't snide! yay!
author: Katy P.

description: My boyfriend turned me on to this place and It is the BOMB!!!!!  It is almost as much fun to people watch here as it is in Manhattan.  The food is incredible yummy and healthy.  The new decor is so chic and yet still as cozy as the first time we went.  If you like dessert this is the place to go.
author: bernadette m.

description:
this is usually the place i go to to get cupcakes for birthdays and such b/c they're bite size & cute, come in a variety of flavors and are yummy!

i also had their sandwiches before and remember them being good. 

i prefer this location b/c there's a parking lot and haven't had a problem looking for parking if the lot is full.
author: quan c.

description:
update to my previous post below: i've been living a half block from this place for now several months and the staff has been helpful, smiling, and genuine "hey, how's it going peple" and i've been really digging the awesome beer selections. 

So it was my second time here so i'm leaving my review open to update at a later time considering i live on the same block as delessio and do plan on going back...

So everything looks gorgeous, the hot food that is not in overwhelming school cafeteria trough portions and all of the sweet itmes are things of beauty.  You can see the care put into the food and that is something worth paying for.  however, there are more than a few shops in cole valley and the richmond that put alot into their deli markets and specialty shops so this isn't worth 5 stars alone. 

I knocked back a star for these precise reasons:

One, not too much selection in some areas such as olive oil, what I went specifically for, and that wouldn't be too bad but the choices weren't that great.  I mean, the convenience store down the corner has more options.  

The store is divided into two sections, the hot food and desserts section and I guess the front grocery/produce/meats/what not section.  I didn't realize it because I came in on the other side and after I got my stuff and gazed at all the hot food glory I was told in a not nice at all and i hate you tone that "you can't buy that here - you have to go over there" and she pointed.  Over there? I'm not sure where.  I just looked around.  And she just stared.  There wasn't even anyone behind me.  She continued to stare.  So I felt sort of dumbish and just walked away.  I figured if I asked her where is over there I'd get my hot food on my face, and again it was her tone.  

Then I (did feel dumb) found on the other side of teh small store where Im suppost to purchase my market items and right as I walked up the checker did a major big ol' sneeze. all over his hand.  and then rang me up. i know, now IM gross, should have walked away, but i had already put my stuff down and conformed to society.  ive had crazy uncontrollable colds & worked in cafes and retail so i understand the dilemma, but it would have been better if he excused himself for some of that liqui-clean gel or something.

so minus the random service and choices what the store does have is really good warm you up options and desserts to make you and your loved ones smile.  if you like food go and take a walk around and your mouth will water water water.
author: Walrus C.

description: I come here a lot for overpriced desert when I feel I deserve it. I find everything else they have is good in theory (fresh roasted vegetables and chicken, cheese and spiced meats) but I rarely make other purchases. That is until I came here on Saturday and met the cheese master herself...best 15 minute education in cheeses that I have experienced anywhere in the city. Taste after taste of deliciousness and I couldn't leave here without a great baguette and some stinky delightful, creamy cheese. Always a good experience...
author: Alicia J.

description: Stopped in for lunch last week, mainly to check out the desserts that I read about on another website.  The sandwich I had was really nice, it was a "cuban pork" hot sandwich.  My wife had a turkey cranberry sandwich, which was also quite good.  The claim to fame here though, is the dessert.  We tried a few different things, but my favorite was actually the chocolate chip oatmeal cookie.  The bubble wrap chocolate bars were pretty interesting as well.
author: Lucas M.

description:
I walked in tonight hoping to order some hors d'oeuvres (damnit, everytime I write that word, I say "oars dev-oars" in my head!!) and casseroles for a dinner party this friday night (today is Wed). I spoke to this beautiful chick named Kat who told me what I was expecting to hear - that there wasn't enough time between tonight and friday night for the catering team to make it happen. BUT she told me that I could order whatever they were going to prepare on friday (chicken jambalaya, hoisin glazed pork ribs, mac-n-cheese, eggplant parmesan, 3 cheese polenta, etc. etc.), and she would come in that morning and set aside that food into large or small containers so that I would be guaranteed some of that yum-yum. She disappeared briefly to print out everything they were going to make for friday so that I could pick out whatever I wanted and let her know by tomorrow. Small trays for $25, large for $50, what a deal.
I went ahead and ordered a chocolate tower cake and caramel praline cheesecake (both which I've had and loved).

I'm so excited for friday. Kat is super duper amazingly awesome!!! We'll see how the food turns out but for now, Delessio gets 5 stars for superior service!
author: Anvy A.

description:
ahhhhhh! cupcakes!!! sweeets! chocolate! cheese! 


GET INTO MY BELLLAYYYYYYY!!!!
author: Stephanie L.

description:
this is the prepared foods place that's connected to faletti foods.  they have better-than-decent pressed sandwiches, prepared stuff for people like me who are lazy and don't cook very often, and a supremely evil dessert counter that is cleverly positioned right next to the checkout.

but for me, the greatest thing about this place is the pure convenience.  it's smack between oak and fell, which is where i so often find myself, idling in traffic, thinking about how i don't have anything at home for dinner.  and you can scoot right into faletti and buy whatever else you need.  and, there's parking.  say no more.
author: brian g.

description: If I were in the neighborhood, I'd shop here a lot for gourmet items. You know it's fresh because you can watch the chefs working very hard to make it fresh for you.
author: Rachel B.

description: Well, I guess I have to come back here and check out the sandwiches, cheeses and meats. I stopped by one day looking for a good mocha espresso. Boy was I disappointed. The espresso wasn't hot like it should be, and the service pretty much sucked. The cupcake I got with the peanut butter mousse topping was really tasty though, but I think i'll pass on the cafe menu. I wanna try some cheese or sandwiches next time i'm in the area, I hear they are good.
author: rich s.

description: The crab cakes are so good I've been looking for the recipe on line for like an hour.  Does anyone have it?  It's more expensive than cooking for yourself, but less than going out to dinner for anything other than Pho or taco's.  I'm giving it 5 stars because they always have something I want, the staff is really nice (like authentically happy to help and enjoying the business they are in) I don't have to argue with anyone over who's doing the dishes, they have beer from Fort Bragg and I'm still thinking about the crab cakes...
author: Rebecca F.

description: Excellent 'Real' Food. Superb grilled veggies & the tres leches cake is amazing. Service is wonderful.
author: Ms. T.

description: While waiting for my Snapper Po Boy today (amazing!) I was offered to sample quite a bit of salami.  The guy behind the counter offered me three different types that had all different types of flavor, sweet, spicy, mild or just melt in your mouth fattiness.  I wouldn't pay 25 bucks a pound for the stuff, but I know where to go when I want to throw a meat, cheese and wine party in my tiny apartment.
author: Josh V.

description:
A huge buffet selection, lots of good stuff, reasonable price.  I'm going back.

Great for lunch or something quick.  Mmmmm.
author: Alex L.

description: I admit  **mea culpa, mea culpa** that I was wrong.  Lately, the Delessios employees do everything they can to make you feel welcome and well fed.  Though I was a bit saddened to see the price of the great rotisserie chickens increase by 50 %, I appreciate their commitment to insuring their employees and providing quality local organic food. Now, if they could only do something about the floor plan... a confusing squish/gauntlet by the registers.
author: Hermes A.

description:
if you can afford it, why would you shop anywhere else?
great salads, a huge variety of freshly cooked meats and dinners
the honey glazed ham i ate was killer
cakes and pudding are their secret weapon.  never bought any but they look utterly evil and amazing.
if i ever need to get a cake, this is where i'm buying it from
noticed they also do catering for parties and the like, seems like a good idea if you wanted to feed a group on mass
author: david s.

description: I was at the DMV renewing my driver's license, and it was lunchtime, so I walked over to this place.  I'd always seen it on my way to 101, so I thought I'd give it a try.  I shared a popyseed roll with lox, cream cheese, onion, and capers, which was fine.  But, what I also got were the mini cupcakes.  We got one peanut butter chocolate cupcake, and a coffee one, and something else, but the most delish one was the one with coconut.  It was so yummy!  How could something sooo good come in such a tiny cupcake.  So, you're wondering why the three stars?  I think it requires another visit to experience all the bakery has to offer.  After reading all the reviews, I can't wait to try their mac n'cheese, and chocolate bubble wrap!?!  Hmmm...definitely piqued my interest.
author: Jen C.

description: the hot food and salad bar is not cheap, i think it's more expensive than whole paycheck.  the sammich was alright, but i didn't like the fancy spread, just give me mayo, mustard, tomatoes, onions, and lettuce with my meat.  the prosciutto mozzarella stuffed peppers are dericious though!!!!
author: Pickle R.

description:
I love the desserts. No qualms with that. Esp. the scones! YUM.

I think the salad bar on the other hand could use a little work. It's good... but not THAT good. Not enough for the prices they charge. Some of it is awesome (white bean dip, chicken), some sucks and is pretty boring actually (most of the veggie stuff). Hot food is mostly good. Soups are give or take....  Most of the prepared food, hot and cold, is too greasy and seems really high fat and calorie and I personally think the mac and cheese is good at BEST. Def not great. But the cheesy polenta with tomato jam is delish. I like the cheese selection... staff seems pretty nice for the most part.

I go there for lunch occasionally, but I'd rather go out for cheaper and/or make my own food. I guess if you don't cook it's a good (but very expensive) option...

* update 10/22/07: salad bar has gotten better. more diversity. is good. me likey. but all the options are so heavy, just a little bit costs a whole lot.
author: Burleigh Girl G.

description: The most underrated bakery in the city for sure. After living next to Tartine, finding a new replacement for all my gluttonous endeavors was going to be difficult...until i found Delessio! I am a Rambanada addict~ dark brown sugar coated brazilian style "french toast". Rocks my world every time. Also, great cakes and cookies and a superb salad bar. Fresh, healthy, and clean. If only it were fat free.
author: summer r.

description:
I want to love this place, really.  I want my wedding cake to be that chocolate thing with the malted vanilla cream. Really.  The cuban sandwich could serve for both PMS and menopausal relief.  

But I am continually frustrated by:
- they move things around every month.  The place was built to spec and it has wasted space, impossible for carrying a cart, and really poor layout.
- no wine or beer.  Getting beverages involves a trip into fallettis or peets.
- inconsistent supply.  One day they have something, the next they dont, or its on order, or they cant find it, or they're not in the mood to deal.  The ready to go meals were great - and then disappeared.  

- the staff is useless.  I waited 20 minutes for a 4 ounce serving of pancetta cos they didnt know what it was or what to charge.  The designer deli items - like crab cakes - seem to sit for days. And at 9 bucks each, who buys?

- the cashier set up needs work.  The queue is a mess  Ordering a grilled sandwich, while very tasty, is a 3 step, 15 minute process.

- duplicity.  Falettis has many of the same things for cheeses and cured meats and bread.  Getting alignment would allow for a lot more variety.

-$1.75 for the cutest 2 bite cupcake?  Fine for the marina, but remember - you're still a block off divis!
author: M M.

description: For a Chocolate Chip Cookie enthusiast  like myself, Delessio gets 5 stars. Terribly addictive and savory, words can't give them justice. If cookies were good for you I would be content eating Delessio's cookies with coffee exclusively for a couple years. Maybe I'll do it anyways.... Soup is good too.
author: teddy d.

description: I'm a fan of the upgraded meats and cheeses that Delissio is offering.  The selection of salami, ham and roast meats is amazing, and I am able to feed my Lardo habit without having to buy it on the black market!  The workers are fastidious and take great time slicing and arranging my purchases.   Not having a sweet tooth, I am immune to a large chunk of their offerings, but I appreciate the selection.
author: John M.

description:
Everything here is SO SO good. The variety of choices is excellent, almost overwhelming. 

Do not leave without trying one of the desserts.

Man, this place is GOOD.
author: Nicole R.

description: Good hot items, especially the brisket (yum), although I think these all suffer from not being made on site - gotta try the Market St location I guess.  Disappointing salad bar, mostly pre-made macaroni salads etc.  The desserts I've tried so far looked or sounded better than they tasted.  But it's not bad.  I'll still stop in frequently and will continue to try various items.
author: Althea R.

description: How excellent to have a place in the neighborhood that serves fresh, organic food--great staff as well. Best meatloaf and great vegetables. This is the way to graze!
author: Lars M.

description: I just erased my original review because I received a very thoughtful email from one of the owners of this treasured place I frequented every chance I could for great perpared food and baked goods.  The food is still great, and my umbrage was with the price increase they recently executed.  It was explained to me in honest, direct words that they wanted to go the route of local, farm raised vegetables, meats, poultry and everything else they serve.  I was also invited to come down and hear their whole process of making this transition and taste whatever I wanted to in addition to learning all that they've tackled to make their food the best money can buy.  I thank Delessio's for their courtesy, passion, commitment and devotion to integrity and health in every aspect of fine food and the joy of tasting the very best, prepared with that same dedication and love.  It's a great place, and they also told me that they are going to attempt to introduce a value menu for so many of us facing reduced resources.  This is a great local fine food business.
author: Stu S.

description: Delessio's!  A gourmet market with amazingly helpful employees and a very confusing floorplan.  Can I just say that the people who work there are so nice and ready to assist with whatever is neccessary.  I almost felt obligated to by more cheese just because they were so helpful.  Now the selection is not that extensive, but hey, what can you expect? And whatever they don't have is readily available next door at Falletti's. So I mentioned the problems with the layout.  Well, it's not that bad, it's just a tad squished and a little bit labrinthian.  Also, the prices are a tiny bit steep, but its worth it for what you're receiving.  Overall, it was an experience well worth the really narrow garage exit which barely fit my car.
author: Kirk J.

description: Absolutely delish...but...$22 for a side of mac and cheese and another of roasted beets. That did not include the chicken - way way too expensive!  Also their pastries are too sweet. Ya don't need that much sugar to make a sweet tasty - they need to take their cue from the European bakeries and chill on the sugar.
author: Diana B.

description: This has got to be the only place in the CITY that sells a corn muffin.  And what a corn muffin it is!  Filled with the most GORGEOUS raspberry jam!  Made my day!  You can tell a lot about a place by the way they treat some of their humblest items, so I must say I'm quite impressed.  And it's a lovely store, too.  Excellent presentation all-around.  Everything looks so well-prepared & tempting, it's hard to not come out of there with more than you need.  Yes both Delessio & Falletti (it's host supermarket), are a tad expensive (understatement, I know).  But to me, the point is not to do ALL of one's shopping here.  Rather, it is to pick up those few, posh items, dinner ingredients for one night, or beautiful, artisan baked goods, and do the rest at Trader Joe's, or somewhere else.  Delessio/Falletti Foods is a godsend for this area, which has been in such sore need of a supermarket... let alone one as posh as this... for a long time.  It's going to do a lot to improve this otherwise borderline ghetto (though definitely up & coming) neighborhood.  I'd give it 5 stars on the strength of their presentation alone, but I haven't been there enough times.  I will DEFINITELY be back, though.
author: Eric H.

description: just happened to be in the area & accidentally came upon this bakery.  never been to the original one on market st., but now i defnitely have to go...........don't know about the food........but they have an AWESOME bakery!!!!  their tres leche cake is the BEST, don't know how you can top that -- its soooo sinfully rich & creamy!!!!!  can't wait for an occassion to come up just so i can buy a whole cake & bring it over to someone's party!   i also had their chocolate cake at a christening (spelling?) & that was absolutely divine for serious chocolate lovers...........    only tried a couple of their choc. bark varieties which were good too!  again, so glad its not that easily accessible.........
author: Cindi N.

description: i give this a begrudging 4 stars. maybe 3.5, really, because in theory, i love this place. the salad bar looks super healthy with mixed greens, etc, and the prepared foods are well labeled and JESUS those desserts look so good. why must you stare up at me and make my sugar-free (mostly. ha) gluten free, dairy free life a living hell? but whenever i've gotten food to go all the prepared stuff is rather greasy and heavy, even like the carrot salad. what gives? tasty, sure, but i feel kind of logged down when i'm done, not light and airy like i should after eating a salad. but the selection is nice and everything is reasonably fresh and tasty. i just wish it wasn't so goddamned greasy.
author: Mary V.

description: best fast food ever.  for $7 i can get 2 slices of meat loaf, potato gratin, and green beans.  you can also pick the mini cupcakes for dessert...sooo good.  the chocolate cakes are to die for...and make super nice bday cakes.
author: Julia H.

description: Good products, good service, but at their premium prices, which are often (not always) 10%-15% higher than, say, Whole Foods, they should be.  My big complaintis that they charge sales tax on cheese, sliced prosciutto, and even baked goods .  I just checked with State Board of Equalization, - and they should not be doing that for anything other than hot prepared food.  Ham, pates, cheeses, baked goods are  exempt from sales tax.
author: aloysius t.

description: The sandwiches are all pre-made so there is no customization. All of the sandwiches are oozing with some kind of mayo base spread and cheese and come out pretty oily. Not untasty, but its hard to enjoy when you know you'll have to run for two hours to burn off half a turkey pannini.
author: Mama L.

description: The food  is definitely worth 4 stars, but the utter confusion isn't worth going back here. The right hand doesn't seem to know what the other hands and feet are doing. And the ear-piercing music only adds to the chaos. I thought perhaps this place was just newly opened, but learned that this is not the case. I'll try Hayes Valley. JP
author: Jeri P.

description: this place really does seem to give an f about what they sell, and i can appreciate the system they use to price it.  if you're smart, you can eat a well-balanced meal for six dollars.  obviously, if you're looking to eat cheap, Popeye's is very close.  the cheese selection is beautiful, and everybody who works there has been more than helpful.   i don't know of a lot of places where they will let you taste ANYTHING before you buy it.
author: jesus c.
